IT 1046, Th. 5.71, Ar. Av. 637: aor. ἐτάχθην A. Eu. 279, etc.; later ἐτάγην [ᾰ] SIG 708.9 ( Istropolis, ii B.C.), Plu. Sollert. 2.965e, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.25.50, etc.: pf. τέταγμαι Pi. O. 2.30, etc.; 3 pl. τετάχαται Th. 3.13, ( ἀντι-) X. An. 4.8.5: 3 pl. plpf. ἐτετάχατο Th. 5.6, 7.4:—

children.definition: draw up in order of battle, form, array, marshal, both of troops and ships, τὴν στρατιήν Hdt. 1.191; τοὺς ὁπλίτας Th. 4.9; νεῶν στῖφος ἐν στίχοις τρισίν A. Pers. 366; πολεμίων στίχας E. Heracl. 676; τ. εἰς μάχην στρατιάν X. Cyr. 1.6.43: abs., Isoc. 18.47:— Pass., to be drawn up, ἐς μάχην Hdt. 1.80; οὐδένα κόσμον ταχθέντες Id. 9.69; ἐπὶ τεττάρων ταχθῆναι in four lines, X. An. 1.2.15; ἐπὶ μιᾶς, of ships, Id. HG 1.6.29; ἐπὶ κέρως Eub. 67.4; κατὰ μίαν ναῦν τεταγμένοι in line, Th. 2.84; ἐπὶ ὀκτώ, of troops, Id. 6.67: abs., τεταγμένοι in rank and file, Id. 2.81 (so metaph., τὸ ἐν τῷ τεταγμένῳ ὄν the rank and file, opp. Senators and Equites, D.C. 49.12); στράτευμα τεταγμένον, opp. ἄτακτον, X. Mem. 3.1.7:— Med., fall in, form in order of battle, freq. in Th., 1.48, 4.11, etc.; ὡς ἐς μάχην 2.20; ἐτάξαντο κύκλον τῶν νεῶν formed in a circle, ib. 83, cf. 3.78; ἐτάξαντο οὐ πάντες ὁμοίως 5.68; εἴκοσι ναυσὶ ἐτάξαντο 3.77 (but in 2.90 trans., ἐπὶ τεσσάρων ταξάμενοι τὰς ναῦς having drawn up their ships in four lines, cf. E. Heracl. 664).

post, station, τὰς καμήλους ἀντία τῆς ἵππου Hdt. 1.80, cf. E. Ph. 749; τινὰς ἐπί τινας one group against another, X. Cyr. 2.1.9 (but τ. τινὰ ἐπὶ τοὺς ἱππέας set him over them, to command them, Id. HG 3.4.20); ἑαυτὸν ὑμῖν τάξαι παρέσχεν for enrolment, Lys. 31.9, cf. Lycurg. 43:— Pass., to be posted or stationed, τῇ οὐδεὶς ἐτέτακτο Hdt. 1.84, cf. A. Pers. 381; ἐς τὸ ὄρος Hdt. 7.212; but ἐς τὸ πεζόν or ἐς π. τετάχθαι to serve among the infantry, ib. 21, 81; ἐς τὸν ναυτικὸν στρατὸν -θέντες ib. 203: c. gen., τῆς πρώτης τάξεως (or simply τῆς πρώτης) τεταγμένος Lys. 14.11, 16.15: c. acc. cogn., τάξιν τινὰ ταχθῆναι Pl. Phdr. 247a, etc.; δεξιὸν τεταγμένους κέρας E. Supp. 657: freq. folld. by Preps. (cf. infr. II.1, etc.), ταχθῆναι or τετάχθαι ἐπί τινα or τινας against another, Th. 3.78, etc.; ἐπί τινι or τισι A. Th. 448, Th. 2.70, 3.13, etc.; also, to be posted at a place, ἐφʼ ἑπτὰ πύλαις ταχθέντες ἴσοι πρὸς ἴσους S. Ant. 142 (anap.); ἐπʼ εὐωνύμῳ κέρατι on the left wing, X. Oec. 4.19; ἐπὶ τοῦ λαιοῦ κέρως Plb. 1.34.4; τ. κατά τινα over against . . , Hdt. 8.85, X. An. 2.3.19; τ. μετά τινα behind him . . , Id. HG 7.2.4 (so ἐπί τινι Id. Lac. 13.7); μετά τινος with him, by his side, Plb. 2.67.2, etc., cf. Th. 2.63; σύν τινι X. An. 3.2.17, etc.; παρὰ τὸν ποταμόν Hdt. 9.15; περὶ τὸ Ἥραιον ib. 69; ἀμφὶ τὴν Κέον Id. 8.76.

data.quote: ἐφʼ ἑπτὰ πύλαις ταχθέντες ἴσοι πρὸς ἴσους

children.label: II
children.definition: appoint to any service, military or civil, the latter being metaph. from the former, ἄρχοντας X. HG 7.1.24; τινὰ ἐπί τινι Id. Cyr. 8.6.17, D. 17.20, etc.; ἐπὶ τὰς πράξεις Isoc. 5.151, cf. Pl. Ly. 209b, etc.; ἀξιῶ σε τάξαι με ἐπί τινος PCair.Zen. 447.3 (iii B.C.): also τ. ἑαυτὸν ἐπί τι undertake a task, Pl. R. 371c, D. 8.71, etc.; πρός τι X. Mem. 2.4.6:— Pass., οἱ τεταγμένοι βραβῆς S. El. 709, cf. 759; πρέσβεις ταχθέντες D. 19.69; τετάχθαι ἐπί τινι to be appointed to a service, Hdt. 1.191, 2.38, A. Pers. 298, E. Ion 1040, X. Cyr. 4.6.1; ἐπί τι Ar. Av. 637, X. Cyr. 1.4.24, etc.; also ἐπί τινος Hdt. 5.109 ( ἐπʼ οὗ, v.l. ὅκου), D. 10.46; τὸν ἐπὶ τῆς σφαγῆς τεταγμένον Plu. Cleom. 38, cf. Plb. 3.12.5; ὁ πρὸς τοῖς γράμμασι τεταγμένος secretary, Id. 15.27.7; οἱ πρὸς ταῖς φυλακαῖς (tolls) τετ. PCair.Zen. 31.15 (iii B.C.).

data.quote: ἀξιῶ σε τάξαι με ἐπί τινος

children.definition: inf., appoint or order one to do or be, τάττετʼ ἐμὲ ἡγεῖσθαι X. An. 3.1.25, cf. Cyr. 7.3.1, Hdt. 3.25, S. OC 639, E. Hec. 223, etc.:— Pass., μοῖρα ἡ ταχθεῖσα . . φρουρέειν Hdt. 4.133, cf. 8.13, A. Eu. 279, 639, etc.; τασσόμενος πορεύεσθαι X. Cyr. 4.5.11, etc.; τοῦτο τετάγμεθα (sc. ποιεῖν) E. Alc. 49; also τεταγμένος κίοι A. Supp. 504; ὁ ἐπʼ Αἴγυπτον ταχθείς (sc. κῆρυξ) ordered to Egypt, Hdt. 3.62, cf. 68, 6.48.

τ. τινί c. inf., Id. 2.124, X. Cyr. 1.5.5, etc.: impers., ἴωμεν . . , ἵνʼ ἡμῖν τέτακται (sc. ἰέναι) S. Ph. 1181 (lyr.); οἷς ἐτέτακτο παραβοηθεῖν Th. 3.22; τοῖς δὲ ἕπεσθαι τέτακται X. Lac. 11.6: also with inf. omitted, κόσμον φυλάσσουσʼ ὅντινʼ ἂν τάξῃ πόλις (sc. φυλάσσειν) E. Supp. 245, cf. 460, Hel. 1390, etc.

assign to a duty or class of dutiful persons, ἐν πᾶσιν ἐμαυτὸν ἔταττον D. 18.221; εἰς ὑπηρετικὴν αὑτοὺς τ. Pl. Plt. 289e; πρός τινας τάξαι αὑτόν Din. 3.18; σὺν ἐμοὶ τ. σεαυτήν D.H. 8.47; τ. ἐμαυτὸν εἰς τάξιν τινά X. Mem. 2.1.8; τινὰς εἰς τοὺς ἀρχικούς ib. 7; εἰς τὴν δουλείαν ἐμαυτόν ib. 11; τ. ἑαυτόν τινων εἶναι range oneself with . . , D. 19.302:— Pass., πρὸς τὴν ξυμμαχίαν ταχθῆναι to join it, Th. 3.86.

children.label: III
children.definition: place in a certain order or relative position, χωρὶς ἑκάτερα τ. Hdt. 7.36; τίνα μέσον τάξω λόγον; E. El. 908; πρῶτον καὶ τελευταῖον τὸ κάλλιστον τ. X. Mem. 3.1.9; τὰ τυφλὰ τοῦ σώματος καὶ ἄοπλα ἐναντία τάττειν τοῖς πολεμίοις Id. Cyr. 3.3.45; τοὺς πόδας [τοῦ ἐμβρύου] κατʼ εὐθὺ τοῦ στομίου τῆς ὑστέρας τάσσειν Sor. 2.60; μὴ κατὰ ἄνεμον τῶν οἰκημάτων τάττειν τὴν ἅλω Gp. 2.26.1; τάξας. . ἀπὸ μὲν δύσεως μίαν θυρίδα φωτὸς ἕνεκεν ib. 14.6.6; [κηρίας] τὴν μεσότητα τάσσειν ὑπὸ τὸ γένειον PMed.Lond. 155ii 29, cf. Sor. Fasc. 25. al.; εἰς ταὐτὸ τ. τὴν εὐτυχίαν τῇ εὐδαιμονίᾳ Arist. EN 1099b7; Λυδοὺς . . πρὸς ἅπαντας range over against, Pl. Plt. 262e; τὴν σοφιστικὴν περὶ τὸ μὴ ὂν ἔταξεν Arist. Metaph. 1026b15, cf. Top. 125b21; c. inf., [ Ὅμηρον] ἐν τοῖς . . σοφωτάτοις εἶναι τάττομεν Aeschin. 1.142; οὐκ εὐλόγως τὸ τοιοῦτον σημεῖον ἐν τοῖς φρενιτικοῖς τάττει Gal. 16.521, cf. 18(2).238; τ. τι ἐπί τινος apply a term to a certain sense, Ath. 1.21a:— Pass., τετάχθαι κατά τινος D.H. 2.48; ἔμπροσθεν τ. τινός Pl. Lg. 631d, cf. X. Mem. 3.1.7, etc.

data.quote: τὰ τυφλὰ τοῦ σώματος καὶ ἄοπλα ἐναντία τάττειν τοῖς πολεμίοις
τοὺς πόδας [τοῦ ἐμβρύου] κατʼ εὐθὺ τοῦ στομίου τῆς ὑστέρας τάσσειν
μὴ κατὰ ἄνεμον τῶν οἰκημάτων τάττειν τὴν ἅλω
[κηρίας] τὴν μεσότητα τάσσειν ὑπὸ τὸ γένειον
εἰς ταὐτὸ τ. τὴν εὐτυχίαν τῇ εὐδαιμονίᾳ
τὴν σοφιστικὴν περὶ τὸ μὴ ὂν ἔταξεν
Ὅμηρον] ἐν τοῖς . . σοφωτάτοις εἶναι τάττομεν
οὐκ εὐλόγως τὸ τοιοῦτον σημεῖον ἐν τοῖς φρενιτικοῖς τάττει

children.label: b
children.definition: inf. and Adj., lay down, rule to be so and so, ἅπερ ἂν . . αἰσχρὰ εἶναι καὶ κακὰ τάττῃ Pl. Lg. 728a; τά τε δίκαια ταχθέντʼ εἶναι καὶ ἄδικα Id. Plt. 305b.

data.quote: ἅπερ ἂν . . αἰσχρὰ εἶναι καὶ κακὰ τάττῃ
τά τε δίκαια ταχθέντʼ εἶναι καὶ ἄδικα

children.definition: ordain, prescribe, τ. τὰ περὶ τὰ τέκνα Arist. Pol. 1262b6: abs., ὁ νόμος οὕτω τ. Pl. La. 199a; οὕτω τ. ὁ λόγος Arist. EN 1119b17:— Pass., τὸ ταττόμενον Ar. Ec. 766; τὸ ταχθὲν τελεῖν S. Aj. 528; τὰ τεταγμένα X. Cyr. 1.2.5, etc.; τὰ τετ. ἄγειν the things appointed to them for conveying, ib. 8.5.4; τῆς τροφῆς ἡ βελτίστη τέτακται τοῖς ἐλευθέροις Arist. GA 744b18; ἐν τῷ τεταγμένῳ εἶναι to be fulfilling oneʼs obligations, IG 1(2).57.47, 2(2).116.48, X. Cyr. 6.2.37.

data.quote: τῆς τροφῆς ἡ βελτίστη τέτακται τοῖς ἐλευθέροις

children.definition: assess, τὸν φόρον ταῖς πόλεσι And. 4.11, cf. Aeschin. 2.23, D. 23.209; ταῖσδε ἔταξαν οἱ τάκται IG 1(2).218.45; so τ. τῷ ναύτῃ δραχμήν X. HG 1.5.4: with inf. added, χρήματα τοῖς πᾶσι τάξαντες φέρειν Th. 1.19, etc. ( Pass., φόρον ἐτάχθησαν φέρειν Hdt. 3.97); τάσσειν ἀργυρίου πολλοῦ fix a high price, Th. 4.26:— Pass., τὸ ταχθὲν τίμημα Pl. R. 551b; εἰσφέρειν τὸ τεταγμένον Arist. Pol. 1272a14:— Med., take a payment on oneself, i.e. agree to pay it, φόρον τάξασθαι Hdt. 3.13, 4.35; χρήματα ἀποδοῦναι ταξάμενοι Th. 1.101; χρήματα ταξάμενοι κατὰ χρόνους ἀποδοῦναι agreeing to pay by instalments, ib. 117, cf. 3.70; πόλεις αὐταὶ ταξάμεναι IG 1(2).212.72, cf. 211 vi 6; also τάξασθαι ἐς τὴν δωρεήν Hdt. 3.97 (but also, much like Act., ἐτάξατο φόρους οἱ προσιέναι ib. 89).

children.label: b
children.definition: Med., generally, agree upon, settle, ταξαμένους . . δέχεσθαι μισθὸν τῆς φυλακῆς Pl. R. 416e; τὰς τιμάς Id. Lg. 743e, cf. 844b, 844c, al.; τέταγμαι ποιμέσιν, οἵ μοι δώσουσιν τιμήν PMich.Zen. 56.19 (iii B.C.); votum expld. as εὐχή, ὃ τάττεταί τις θεῷ, Gloss.: c. inf. fut., PEnteux. 54.5 (iii B.C.), Plb. 18.7.7, al.

data.quote: τέταγμαι ποιμέσιν, οἵ μοι δώσουσιν τιμήν

children.label: c
children.definition: Med., pay, τῆς δὲ τιμῆς τάξονται παραχρῆμα τὸ δʹ μέρος, τὸ δὲ λοιπὸν ἐν ἔτεσι γʹ PEleph. 14.18 (iii B.C.), cf. PEnteux. 60.9, 89.7, PMich.Zen. 79.9, PCair.Zen. 649.16 (all iii B.C.), PAmh. 2.31.1, 52.1, Ostr.Bodl. i 46, 96, al., PLond. 3.1201.1, 1202.1 (all ii B.C.).

data.quote: τῆς δὲ τιμῆς τάξονται παραχρῆμα τὸ δʹ μέρος, τὸ δὲ λοιπὸν ἐν ἔτεσι γʹ

children.definition: impose punishments, τ. δίκην Ar. V. 1420, etc.; τ. ζημίας, τιμωρίας, Pl. Lg. 876c, D. 20.143; τῷ κλέψαντι θάνατον Lycurg. 65:— also in Med., Hdt. 2.65.

children.label: b
children.definition: impose laws, οὓς [νόμους] ἔταξε αὐτοῖς ὁ νομοθέτης Pl. Lg. 772c.

pf. part. Pass., fixed, settled, prescribed, ὁ τεταγμένος χρόνος (like τακτός) Hdt. 2.41, etc.; ὥρα E. Ba. 723; ἡμέρα X. Cyr. 1.2.4; ἔτη Pl. Lg. 810b; ἡ τετ. χώρα X. Cyr. 5.3.40; αἱ τετ. θυσίαι the regular offerings, Id. HG 3.3.4; οἱ ἐπὶ τούτῳ τετ. [νόμοι] Pl. Cri. 50d; ἡ τετ. δίαιτα prescribed, Id. R. 404a; τὰ τετ. ὀνόματα received, Isoc. 9.9; τετ. τέχνη regular, Id. 13.12; τεταγμένον, opp. ἄτακτον, Arist. Cael. 280a8; νὺξ τὰ τεταγμένʼ ἀπέχει Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 37.6; of geom. figures, regular, i.e. equilateral and equiangular, Papp. 306.2, 8, al.--cf. τεταγμένως.
daddy, AP 11.67 ( Myrin.): dub. cj. for ταῦτα in Thphr. Char. 7.10.
call by pet name (cf. τατί), coax, Herod. 1.60, 6.77.

definition: τατάομαι, Dor. for τητάομαι. τᾶτες, v. τῆτες.
τατί, familiar name applied by slave to mistress, Herod. 5.69.
τατικός, ή, όν, ( τείνω) neut. τατικόν,

children.definition: territibile (sic), Gloss.
exerting tension, Orib. 49.2.7.
that can be stretched, Arist. HA 519a32.

definition: τατύρας, ὁ, oriental name of the

children.definition: pheasant, Pamphil. ap. Ath. 9.387e; cf. τέταρος, τέτραξ. (Cf. Mod. Pers. tedzrev ‘pheasant’, Lith. teterva ‘black grouse’, etc.: the bird τέταρος was imported from Media acc. to Ath. 14.654c.)

definition: ταῦ, τό, the letter τ, Hp. VC 1, Pl. Cra. 394c, IG 2(2).2783.20 (iv B.C.), Sor. Fasc. 45, etc.

children.definition: Mount Taygetus, between Laconia and Messenia, Od. 6.103, Hdt. 4.145, etc.: later Ταΰγετος, ὁ, Plu. Exil. 2.601d, Luc. Icar. 11 (s.v.l.).

definition: ταυληρόντα ἱμάντα, Ἡρακλέων, Hsch. (perh. cf. εὔληρα).

children.definition: Gloss.
the one who releases the bull at a bull-fight, LW 499 ( Caryanda).
want the bull, of cows, Arist. HA 572a31.

definition: Ταυρεασταί, οἱ, worshippers of Poseidon at Ephesus, Ephes. 2.75 (i B.C.).

children.definition: bullʼs hide, ox-hide, hence,
a kind of drum covered with skin, Gp. 14.25.3 (unless in sense 2).
whip of ox-hide, Artem. 1.70, Phot. s.v. μάραγνα.

definition: ταύρειος, α, ον, also ος, ον E. Hel. 1582:—

children.definition: of bulls, oxen, or cows, φόνος A. Th. 44; κέρατα, αἷμα, S. Tr. 518 (lyr.), Fr. 178, Ar. Eq. 83; χολή Sor. 1.64, POxy. 234.45 (ii/iii A.D.), PHolm. 6.37, al.; στέαρ Sor. 2.14, Gal. 10.957; πούς E. Hel. 1555; ἀγέλαι Theoc. 27.71; βρίμας ταυρείους Orph. Fr. 79.
of bullʼs-hide, κυνέη, ἀσπίς, Il. 10.258, 13.161, etc.; ἱμάντες Onos. 10.4: cf. foreg. and ταύρεος.
ox-driver, PGoodsp.Cair. 30 vi8 (ii A.D.), PFlor. 134.3 (iii A.D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: toreador, τ. χορὸς ἀνδρῶν AP 9.543 ( Phil.), cf. Hld. 10.30.
tame Indian buffalo, Cosmas Indicopleustes 11 (ed. E. O. Winstedt, Cambr. 1909); also a wild Ethiopian species, ibid., Ael. NA 17.45.
PMag.Par. 1.2548.
IG 2(2).1672.161; τὰ τ. τύμπανα Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 37.16; τ. κέρατα Orph. Fr. 168.14; ζωστήρια PLond. 2.402v. 8 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Hes. Sc. 104, because bulls were offered to him at Onchestus, acc. to Sch.; written Ταύρειος, Hsch. s.v. ταῦρος; Ταύριος, Suid.

definition: Ταυρεών, ῶνος, ὁ, name of a month at Miletus, Cyzicus, etc., SIG 57.23 ( Milet.), CIG 3657.13 (Cyzic.), Herod. 7.86, etc.: also Ταυρειών, IG 12(7).62.10 ( Amorgos).

children.definition: like a bull, ἔβλεψε γοῦν τ. ἐγκύψας κάτω Ar. Ra. 804; τ. ὑποβλέψας πρὸς τὸν ἄνθρωπον Pl. Phd. 117b.
PFlor. 321.19 (ii A.D.), etc.

definition: ταυρίδιον [ ῐδ], τό, Dim. of ταῦρος, Suid.

children.definition: of oxen, ζεύγη PLille 8.8, PCair.Zen. 216.5, PSI 4.429.25 (all iii B.C.).
ταυρικόν, τό, ox-team for ploughing, PStrassb. 32.17 (iii A.D.), PGen. 76.6 (iii/iv A.D.), PFay. 131.17 (iii/iv A.D.).

definition: ταυρινάδαι, οἱ, a guild of cobblers, Ephes. 2.80, 81 [ ταυρειν- lapis].
ταυρίνδα φαλλικὴ παιδιὰ παρὰ Ταραντίνοις, Hsch.

children.definition: taurina, a kind of shoe, Edict.Diocl. 9.15.
bellowing like a bull, Orph. H. 6.3.
sacrificial slaughter of a bull, IGRom. 4.494 (Pergam.), 499 (ibid.), IG 2(2).4842.4; in Lat. form taurobolium, CIL 10.1596 ( Puteoli).
striking or slaughtering bulls, τελετὴ τ., = ταυροβόλιον, IG 2(2).4841.3, 11, 14.1018, 1020.
devouring bulls, λέων APl. 16.94 ( Arch.).
made of bullʼs hide, βίρρος Edict.Diocl. 22.23.
with bullʼs paunch: metaph., enormous, APl. 16.52 ( Phil.).

definition: ταυρογενής, ές, doubtful epith. of Dionysus, Orph. Fr. 297.

children.definition: bull-binder, in fem. ταυρο-δέτις, ιδος, βύρσα AP 6.41 ( Agath.).
made from bullʼs hide, κόλλα E. Fr. 472.7 (s.v.l., anap.).
training of (performing) bulls, Milet. 1(7).205a (ii A.D.).
half-bull half-snake, prob. in PMag.Par. 1.2613 ( -διακ- Pap.).
bull-like, τ. τὴν μορφήν Str. 17.3.5.
bull-hunt, = ταυροκαθάψια, IG 9(2).531 ( Larissa).
sacrifice of a bull, Supp.Epigr. 4.180.6 ( Ceramus, i B.C.).
sacrifice a bull or bulls, IG 7.2712.22 (Acraeph.).
at the sacrifice of a bull, λοιβή Orph. A. 614.
bull-fighter, CIG 2759b(add.) ( Aphrodisias), OGI 533.46 ( Ancyra, i A.D.).
bull-fight, held on occasion of a festival in Thessaly, Sch. Pi. P. 2.78; at Smyrna, CIG 3212; at Sinope, ib. 4157: also ταυρο-κάθαψις, εως, ἡ, IGRom. 4.460 (Pergam.), unless ταύρο-ψιν is for -ψιον.
bull-headed, Nonn. D. 26.317, PMag.Par. 1.2808.

definition: ταυροκένται, οἱ, in Lat.form Taurocentae, bull-stabbers (in bull-fights), CIL 10.1074 ( Pompeii).

children.definition: a kind of river-boat, PCair.Zen. 242 (iii B.C.), Suid.
bull-horned, E. Ba. 100 (lyr.), Euph. 14, Orph. H. 52.2.
bull-headed, of Bootes, Teucer in Boll Sphaera 18,49.
glue made from bulls’ hides, Plb. 6.23.3, Dsc. 3.87, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.23.6, Gal. 12.832, Paul.Aeg. 7.3.
like bullʼs-hide glue, Dsc. 1.67, 4.170.
bull-headed, E. Or. 1378 (lyr.), APl. 16.126.
Hsch.
slaughter or sacrifice bulls, θεοῖσιν A. Th. 276; βοῦς τ. S. Tr. 760.
killing bulls, λέοντες S. Ph. 400 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ταυρόκτονος, ον, Pass., killed by a bull, Ammon. Diff. p.129V.
bull-fight, OGI 533.45 ( Ancyra, i A.D.), IGRom. 3.631.14 ( Xanthus).
bull-faced, Orph. H. 45.1.
bull-formed, ὄμμα Κηφισοῦ E. Ion 1261, cf. Ph. 2.160, Ath. 11.476a; κάνθαρος τ. PMag.Par. 1.65.
become savage as a bull, A. Ch. 275; take the form of a bull, E. Ba. 922; τ. ὄμμα τινί cast savage glances on one, Id. Med. 92.
Act., ταύρωσον· ταῦρον ποίησον, Hsch.
bull-maiden, i.e. Io, Lyc. 1292, cf. Tz. ad loc.
sprung from a bull, of bees, Theoc. Syrinx 3.
festival of Artemis Tauropolos, Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1932 Supp. 30 ( Attica, iv B.C.), Men. Epit. 234.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ταυροπόλιον, τό, temple of Artemis on the island of Icaria, Str. 14.1.19.

definition: ταυροπόλος, ἡ, E. IT 1457, Ar. Lys. 447, CIG 2699 ( Mylasa); also ταυροπόλα, S. Aj. 172 (lyr.):—a name of Artemis (cf. Ταυρώ), variously interpreted as

children.definition: worshipped at Tauris, or drawn by a yoke of bulls, or hunting bulls; cf. Ister 8; applied to Iphigenia, Ant.Lib. 27.3.

definition: ταυρόπους, ὁ, ἡ, πουν, τό, gen. ποδος,

children.definition: bull-footed, σῆμα, of a river-god, E. IA 275 (lyr.).
bull-faced, θεός PMag. Leid.W. 1.30, cf. Hermes Trism. in Rev.Phil. 32.266; ναῦς Sch.Par. A.R. 2.168.
having a bull on the prow, as figurehead, πλοῖον Sch. Lyc. 1292.
bull, Il. 2.481, etc.; as a sacrifice to Poseidon, 11.728, Od. 13.181; also ταῦρος βοῦς Il. 17.389; ἄπεχε τῆς βοὸς τὸν τ., oracularly of Agamemnon and his wife, A. Ag. 1126 (lyr.).
priest of Poseidon Taureios, Ath. 10.425c.
Poll. 1.83.

children.label: II
children.definition: the bull as a sign of the Zodiac, Eudox. ap. Hipparch. 1.2.10, Arat. 167, al., IG 14.1307, Supp.Epigr. 7.363.8 (Dura-Europus, ii A.D.), etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: Poll. 2.173, Gal. 14.706: also the pudenda muliebria, Phot.: the male αἰδοῖον, Suid. (Cf. Lat. taurus, Lith. tauras, Slav. turǔ, etc.)
cut a bullʼs throat, τ. ἐς σάκος cut its throat (so that the blood runs) into a hollow shield, A. Th. 43, cf. Sch. Ar. Lys. 189.
bull-slaughtering, esp. in sacrifice, τ. ἡμέρα S. Tr. 609; τ. λέαινα Lyc. 47; of dithyrambic poets, Tz. Diff. Poet. 17.

definition: ταυροτενής, ές, dub. sens. in Dain Inscr. du Louvre 60.25 (Heraclea ad Latmum).

children.definition: bull-eating, epith. of Dionysus, S. Fr. 668; applied to Cratinus by Ar. Ra. 357 (anap.).
bull-like, D.P. 642.
bull-eyed, Heph.Astr. 2.2.
bellowing like a bull, τ. μῖμοι sounds that imitate the bellowing of bulls, A. Fr. 57.8 (anap.).
Pi. N. 6.40; δόρπα AP 11.60 ( Paul.Sil.); τ. λέων BCH 21.599 ( Delph., iv B.C.), Orph. H. 14.2; f.l. in Theoc. 17.20.
stamped with the device of a bull, τετρᾶχμα Inscr.Délos 1429 B ii 41 (ii B.C.).
having a bull as a figurehead, ναῦς St.Byz. s.v. Ταυρόεις.
bull-shaped, Nonn. D. 7.153.

definition: Ταυρώ, οῦς, ἡ, a name of Artemis (cf. ταυροπόλος), Hsch.

children.definition: Nic. Al. 222.

definition: Ταυρών, ῶνος, ὁ, a month at Alexandria, Ptol. Alm. 9.7.

children.definition: bull-faced, Ion Lyr.9, Orph. H. 29.4, Corn. ND 22: neut. as Adv., ταυρωπὸν ἀποβλεψάμενοι Ph. 1.602: fem. ταυρ-ῶπις, Nonn. D. 32.69; epith. of Isis in Samothrace, POxy. 1380.107 (ii A.D.).
like a bull, τὸ τ. Sch. Nic. Al. 31.

ταΰσας· μεγαλύνας, πλεονάσας, Hsch.:— hence Madvig restored κεκτημένος ταῢ χρυσίον (for τʼ αὖ πολὺ χρ.) in Poet. ap. Pl. Tht. 175c-- πολύ (which is absent in codd. BT, though added by a later hand in T and found (without τʼ αὖ or ταῢ) in the citation by Iamb. Protr. 14) being a gloss.

definition: ταῦτα, neut. pl. of οὗτος: but ταὐτά, crasis for τὰ αὐτά.

children.definition: IG 12(3).248.15 ( Anaphe, ii B.C.): written ταυτα (spondee) ib. 5(1).213.4 (Sparta, V B.C.).
use as synonymous, Eust. 8.33, etc.; ἕν εἰσι καὶ ταὐτίζονται Procl. in Prm. ( Suppl.) p.1008 S.
write in the same way, Eust. 45.46.
to be equivalent, mean the same, Sch. E. Or. 162.
having the form of identity, Dam. Pr. 340. Adv. -ειδῶς, synonym for ὡσαύτως, ib. 349.
Hsch., Suid.
Phot., Suid.
resembling or approaching identity, Dam. Pr. 350, 439.
in the same latitude, Str. 2.1.16, 17.3.8.
repeat what has been said, περί τινος Plb. 1.1.3; ὑπέρ τινος Id. 1.79.7; τ. τὸν λόγον Str. 12.3.27:—abs., Plb. 36.12.2, Phld. Po.Herc. 994.30, Hermog. Inv. 3.15.
tautology, Eust. 948.56.

definition: ταὐτολογία, ἡ, = foreg., D.H. Comp. 23, Ph. 1.529, Quint. Inst. 8.3.50: pl. in Plu. Garr. 2.504d.

children.definition: tautologically, Eust. 122.6.
repeating what has been said, tautologous, AP 9.206 ( Eupith.).
of the same length, Nicom. Ar. 2.18.
identity of meaning, Eust. 1530.21.
following the same rule, Tz. in An.Par. 1.70.
become identified, πρός τι Dam. Pr. 305: abs., opp. ἑτεροιοῦται, Procl. in Prm. p.899 S.
reflex signification, Hdn.Gr. ap. An.Ox. 3. 271, EM 67.44.
repetition of the same foot in the same verse, Sch. Ar. Ra. 346, Heph. 3.3, Mar.Vict. p.47 K., Atil.Fort. p.280 K.
act as deputy, PPetr. 2p.45 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: do the same thing, Phld. Po. 2.1.
creating identity, Procl. in Cra. p.20 P., Dam. Pr. 305, al.
keep repeating the same thing, Tz. H. 10.851.
identical, in nom. pl. masc. ταὐτοί, Syrian. in Metaph. 137.22, 25, 26, Sch. Theoc. 1.56 codd.; τὸ ταὐτό Arist. Metaph. 1054b15; τὸ ταὐτόν Syrian. in Metaph. 62.32, al.
of the same signification, Eust. 103.23:

definition: ταὐτοσήμαντος, ον, Sch. E. Hec. 16, Eust. 101.37.

children.definition: have the same syllables, EM 193.52.
identity, Arist. EN 1161b31, Metaph. 995b21, Gal. 6.643, Dam. Pr. 423, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: monotony, D.H. Comp. 12, 19, Hermog. Meth. 37.

children.label: III
children.definition: identical condition, ἐν τ. μεῖναι POxy. 940.2 (V A.D.); maintenance of identity, Plot. 1.2.7.
presenting the appearance of identity, Dam. Pr. 241.
of the same sound, Eust. 125.5: hence ταὐτο-φωνία, ἡ, ib. 20.
make identical, Procl. in Prm. pp. 899,923 S.
identified substance, Procl. in Prm. p.863 S.
of the same name, Speus. ap. Simp. in Cat. 38.20.
τάφε, v. τέθηπα.
tomb, IGRom. 3.1381 (Arabia, prob. ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ταφεῖον, τό, tomb, BCH 52.401 ( Priene).
burier, grave-digger, S. OC 582, El. 1488, Plu. Comp.Pel.Marc. 3.
burial-ground, Supp. Epigr. 7.161, 167 ( Palmyra, ii A.D.), OGI 642 (ibid., iii A.D.); written ταφαιών, Supp.Epigr. 7.166 (ibid., ii A.D.):—also ταφών, IG 12(1).656 ( Rhodes).

burial, ταφῆς τυχεῖν, κυρῆσαι, Hdt. 1.24, 112: in pl., mode of burial, Id. 2.85, 5.8: pl. also of the burials of those who had fallen in battle, δημοσίᾳ ταφὰς ἐποιήσαντο Th. 2.34; νόμοι . . , οἷς ἐχρῶντο περὶ τὰς ταφάς ib. 52, cf. OGI 90.32 ( Rosetta, ii B.C.).

burial-place, Hdt. 4.71, 5.63, S. Aj. 1090, 1109: later in sg., Sammelb. 6028.2, al. (i B.C.): but σῆς εἰ στερήσομαι ταφῆς, of the urn supposed to contain the ashes of Orestes, S. El. 1210; so in Egypt, mummy, POxy. 736.13 (i A.D.), Wilcken Chr. 499 (ii/iii A.D.), etc.; also, sarcophagus, δευτέρα τ., of a double sarcophagus, PGiss. 68.7 (ii A.D.), Arch.Pap. 4.133 (ii A.D.).
payment for burial, burial-fee, τὸν τὴν τ. τοῦ πατρὸς οὐκ ἀπειληφότα D. 25.58; ἐνδεεῖς γενόμενοι εἰς τὴν τ. τὴν Φιλίππου PEnteux. 32.6 (iii B.C.); ὑπὲρ τέλους ταφῆς μιᾶς Ostr.Bodl. ii 45 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: τὸν τὴν τ. τοῦ πατρὸς οὐκ ἀπειληφότα
ἐνδεεῖς γενόμενοι εἰς τὴν τ. τὴν Φιλίππου

definition: ταφήϊος, η, ον, Ep. for ταφεῖος (not found),

children.definition: of or for a burial, φᾶρος τ. a windingsheet, shroud, Od. 2.99; μῆλα, i.e. for sacrifice, A.R. 2.840.
burial-money, PEnteux. 20.5, 21.8 (iii B.C.), IG 2(2).1323.11 (iii/ii B.C.), Ostr.Bodl. i 134 (pl., ii B.C.), BGU 1668.14 (i A.D.).
gravestone, AP 7.40 ( Diod.).

children.label: II
children.definition: τάφια, τά, burial-place, IG 12(1).736 ( Camirus, iii B.C.): but also τᾶν ταφιᾶν (from ταφία or ταφιά) Supp.Epigr. 3.674 A4, al. ( Rhodes, ii B.C.).
like a burial or grave, στήλη D.C. 67.9.

funeral-rites, Il. 23.619, Od. 4.547; δαινύναι τάφον to give a funeral-feast, Il. 23.29, Od. 3.309; τελέσαι τάφον Ἕκτορι δίῳ to perform the funeral-rites, Il. 24.660; so ὃν πόλις στυγεῖ, σὺ τιμήσεις τάφῳ; A. Th. 1051; τάφῳ κτερίζειν S. Ant. 203; τάφον τινὸς θέσθαι Id. OT 1447; τ. περιστέλλειν νεκροῦ Id. Aj. 1170; τάφου τυχεῖν obtain the rites of burial, E. Hec. 47; τοιόσδε ὁ τ. ἐγένετο Th. 2.47: pl. of a single funeral, Pl. R. 414a; so of cremation, Clitarch. 32 J.
the act of performing the funeral-rites, τοῦδε τοῦ τ. φήσεις μετασχεῖν S. Ant. 534.

children.label: II
children.definition: grave, tomb, Hes. Sc. 477, Pi. I. 8(7).63, A. Pers. 686, Ch. 168, S. El. 1218 sq., Hdt. 2.136, Th. 1.26, etc. (never in Hom.): pl. of a single grave, S. OC 411; ὄντες ἐν τάφοις dead and buried, A. Eu. 767; μέγας γʼ ὀφθαλμὸς οἱ πατρὸς τάφοι his being dead and buried, S. OT 987:— γῦπες ἔμψυχοι τάφοι Gorg. 5a.
ἔμψυχός τις τ. a ‘living skeleton’, Luc. DMort. 16[6].2.
Duris 34 J.
φόνος, Sch. Il. 23.29.
astonishment, amazement, τ. δʼ ἕλε πάντας Od. 21.122, cf. 24.441; τ. δέ οἱ ἦτορ ἵκανεν 23.93; dat. τάφει Ibyc. 21.
making of ditches or trenches, D. 18.299, Delph. 3(5).74.44 (iv B.C.), Plb. 5.2.5, etc.: collectively, entrenchments, Ph. Bel. 80.19, 85.46, D.C. 36.54, al.
ditch, Pl. Lg. 761b, D.C. Fr. 57.33, Fr. 98.1.
digging, method of digging, Ael. NA 9.8.
ditcher, PCair.Zen. 744.9 (iii B.C.).
make a ditch, Pl. Lg. 760e, 778e, X. HG 5.2.4; τάφρους τ. Aeschin. 3.236: c. acc., τὰ ἔσωθεν Aen.Tact. 33.4.

definition: τάφρη, ἡ, Ion. for τάφρος (which is v.l.), Hdt. 4.28, 201: also τράφη, IG 12(7).62.27 ( Amorgos, iv B.C.).

children.definition: fossam duco, Gloss.
ditch-like, trench-like, Sch.D Il. 2.153.
make a trench for besieging, D.S. 23.7.

ditch, trench, freq. in Il. (once in Od., 21.120); τάφρον ὀρύξομεν Il. 7.341, cf. IG 1(2).94.21, 34, Th. 2.78, al.; ἀμφὶ δὲ τάφρον ἤλασαν drew a trench, Il. 7.449, cf. Hdt. 4.3, Alcid. Od. 5, etc.; τάφρων ὕπερ over the trenches, S. Aj. 1279, cf. Aen.Tact. 37.3, al., OGI 90.24 ( Rosetta, ii B.C.); irrigation-ditch, PHal. 1.97, al., PSI 6.597.5 (both iii B.C.): it is sts. found as masc. in codd., e.g. Ph. Bel. 99.43 (cod. V), D.S. 22.10.5; but βαθύν is Ep. for βαθεῖαν in Call. Del. 37: Dor. τράφος Tab.Heracl. 1.130, 2.51.
sapper and miner, D.L. 4.23.
vallatus, Gloss.

quickly, presently, forthwith, freq. in Hom., who, like Pi. ( O. 2.29, 4.83, al.) and B. ( 5.89), uses it only of time, Il. 1.205, 2.193, al.; ἦ τ. soon iʼfaith, Od. 18.73, 338; of past time, τ. δʼ Ἕκτορος ἄγχι γένοντο Il. 8.117: also in Trag.and (more rarely) Att. Prose and Com., with fut., τάχʼ εἴσομαι A. Th. 261, cf. Ag. 489, 1649, Ch. 305, S. OT 84, Ar. Ra. 527, Pl. Sph. 247d, etc.; ἔοικα θεσπιῳδήσειν τ. A. Ag. 1161; πέμψον πρὸς ἐμὲ τ. Sammelb. 7356.25 (ii A.D.); in this sense not found in LXX or in Papyri (exc. l.c.); τάχα ἐπειδάν, = ἐπειδὰν τάχιστα, as soon as, Pl. Phdr. 242a.

children.label: II
children.definition: perhaps, to express any contingency from a probability to bare possibility, δὶς μὲν γὰρ καὶ τρὶς τ. τεύξεαι Hes. Op. 401; τ. οὐδὲ τεθέασθε τυραννουμένην πόλιν Pl. Lg. 711a, cf. Hp. Ma. 303b, X. An. 5.2.17, Theoc. 27.61, Bion Fr. 4.8, Gal. 16.685,690: more freq. τάχʼ ἄν, probably, perhaps, Hdt. 1.70, al., freq. in Trag. and Att.; mostly with opt., as Hdt. l.c., A. Pr. 314, Eu. 512 (lyr.), S. OT 139, Th. 1.81, etc.; rarely with aor. ind., Pl. Phdr. 256c, Gal. 16.596; with impf. ind., D. 36.55; with part., S. OT 523, Th. 6.2; with inf., Luc. Icar. 10; τάχʼ ἄν alone, in answers, Pl. Sph. 255c, R. 369a, etc.: strengthd., τάχα . . ἴσως Ar. Th. 718; ἴσως τ. X. HG 7.1.24; τ. τοίνυν ἴσως D. 21.191; τάχʼ ἂν ἴσως Pl. Plt. 264c; τάχʼ ἴσως ἄν Id. Sph. 247d; ἴσως τάχʼ ἄν S. Aj. 691, Th. 6.34, Pl. Ti. 38e; ἀμφισβητοῦντες προστιθέασιν ἀεὶ τὸ ἴσως καὶ τ. Arist. Rh. 1389b19; in this sense only twice in LXX ( Wi. 13.6, 14.19).

data.quote: δὶς μὲν γὰρ καὶ τρὶς τ. τεύξεαι

children.label: III
children.definition: Sup. τάχιστα, v. ταχύς C. II.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Ar. formed an acc. pl. τάχας, perhaps-es, Fr. 869.
make swift, Al. Hb. 3.19.

definition: ταχίνας, ὁ, Lacon. name of the

children.definition: hare, Ael. NA 7.47; of the deer, Hsch.
ταχύς, φρένες, ἴουλοι, Theoc. 2.7, Call. Jov. 56, cf. A.R. 2.1044, LXX Wi. 13.2, al., 2 Ep.Pet. 2.1, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.137, etc.: Sup. -ώτατος Arat. 289: neut. pl. ταχινά, = τάχα, Theoc. 14.40.

definition: ταχίων, τάφρ-ιον, τάχιστος, τάφρ-ιστα, v. ταχύς c.

children.definition: swiftness, speed, ἵπποισι . . , οἷσιν Ἀθήνη νῦν ὤρεξε τ. Il. 23.406, cf. 515; τ. καὶ βραδυτής Pl. Tht. 156c, Arist. Ph. 228b29, etc.: pl., velocities, Pl. Ti. 39d, Lg. 893d.
τ. φρενῶν quickness of temper, hastiness, E. Ba. 670; ὁ χρόνος μάθησιν ἀντὶ τοῦ τάχους . . δίδωσι Id. Supp. 419; f.l. in Pl. Lg. 944c; τ. τῆς ψυχῆς quickness of apprehension, ib. 689c.

data.quote: ὁ χρόνος μάθησιν ἀντὶ τοῦ τάχους . . δίδωσι

children.label: II
children.definition: τάχος is freq. used in Adverbial phrases for ταχέως, abs. in acc., A. Th. 58, Ag. 945, Eu. 124, E. Rh. 986, HF 860 (troch.), etc.; also in dat., τάχει ὁμοίως with like velocities, Pl. Ti. 36d: with Preps., διὰ τάχους S. Aj. 822, Th. 1.63, etc.; ἐν τάχει Pi. N. 5.35, A. Pr. 747, S. OC 500, Th. 1.86, PCair.Zen. 62 ( b). 10 (iii B.C.), etc.; εἰς τάχος X. Eq. 3.5, Ar. Ach. 686, etc.; κατὰ τάχος Hdt. 1.124, 152, Th. 1.73; κατὰ τὸ τ. PCair.Zen. 130.11 (iii B.C.); τὸ τ. (without κατὰ) ib. 158.2, 166.4, 428.15, PHib. 1.62.13 (all iii B.C.). etc.; μετὰ τάχους Pl. Prt. 332b; μετὰ παντὸς τ. with all speed, POxy. 2107.4 (iii A.D.); σὺν τάχει S. Aj. 853, OC 885 (lyr.), 904: also with relatives, ὡς τάχος, = ὡς τάχιστα, A. Ag. 27, Ch. 889, Hdt. 5.106, Ar. Lys. 1187; so ὅ τι τάχος Hdt. 9.7.βʹ, Th. 7.42, PCair.Zen. 60.8 (iii B.C.); ὅσον τάχος S. El. 1373, etc.; ᾗ ( Dor. ᾇ) τάχος Pi. O. 6.23, Theoc. 14.68: also ὡς τάχεος εἶχε ἕκαστος Hdt. 8.107, cf. Th. 2.90; ὡς εἶχον τάχους Id. 7.2; πῶς πρὸς ἄλληλα τάχους ἔχει Pl. Grg. 451c.
conquered quickly or easily, χώρη Hdt. 7.130.
fast-walking, Arist. Phgn. 813a7; also τᾰχῠ-βήμων, as gloss on αὐριβάτας, Hsch. ( -βήλων cod.).

definition: ταχυβάτης [ ᾰ], ου, ὁ, = foreg., E. Rh. 134 (lyr.).

children.definition: quick sprouting, Thphr. CP 4.1.3, 4.8.1.
sprouting quickly, Thphr. CP 4.1.3 ( Comp.).
hasty in counsel, opp. μετάβουλος, perh. with allusion to the votes respecting Mytilene ( Th. 3.36), Ar. Ach. 630; cf. Max. 76.
early-marrying, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.166.
soon becoming decrepit, neut. pl. ταχύγηρα Hp. Art. 58; περὶ τοῦ μὴ τ. γίνεσθαι τὸ ζῷον Gal. 6.9; ταχύγηροι περὶ τὴν κεφαλήν turning grey early, Id. 1.328.

data.quote: περὶ τοῦ μὴ τ. γίνεσθαι τὸ ζῷον

children.definition: quick of tongue, talking fast, Hp. Epid. 2.6.1, Ruf. Fr. 70, etc.
quick reproduction, Arist. HA 580b27.
yielding fruit quickly or soon, Thphr. CP 4.3.6.
shorthand writer, Lyd. Mag. 3.6, Stud.Pal. 20.247.2 (vi/vii A.D.):—hence τᾰχῠ-γρᾰφέω, write shorthand, Tz. H. 8.267, Eust. 1607.10.
burning quickly, Agath. 1.10.
soon moved to tears, Luc. Nav. 2.
whirling quickly, Nonn. D. 34.1.
run fast, Sch. E. Med. 1; of Venus, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.133.
quickness in running, Arist. Pr. 881b7.
fast-running, Nonn. D. 29.365, Orph. H. 27.3, Aesop. 157.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. -δρόμος, ὁ, courier, PMasp. 131.5, al. (vi A.D.); = cursor, Gloss. [Proparox. in Nonn. and Orph. ll.cc., parox. in Aesop. and Gloss. ll. cc.]
App. BC 3.19.
quickness in working, X. Cyr. 7.1.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: hastiness, App. Pun. 33.
doing or working quickly, Nonn. D. 28.79; ὀπός ib. 29.157; epith. of Horus, Sammelb. 5620.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: hasty, App. Pun. 47, BC 2.120, Adam. 1.16.
fast-rowing, rapid, A. Supp. 32 (anap.), Opp. H. 4.569.
early death. Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.165.
liable to sudden death, Hp. Aph. 2.44; τ. εἶναι, = ταχέως θνῄσκειν, Id. Epid. 1.12; = decrepitus, Gloss.

children.label: II
children.definition: killing speedily, Hp. Acut. 56, Art. 66 ( Sup.).
riding fast, Sch. Ar. Nu. 729.
hasty in spirit, Thd. Is. 35.4.
setting rapidly, ζῴδια Sch. Ptol. Tetr. 114.
quick movement, Sch. Ptol. Tetr. 17.
moving quickly, Gal. 19.631, Porph. in Harm. p.240 W., Adam. 2.45.
coming quickly to a crisis, Hp. Epid. 1.24, Gal. 15.172, al.
quick to learn, Poll. 4.11.
quick to the fray, Hsch. s.v. ὠκυβόας.
quickly changing, Ptol. Tetr. 162, Geog. 1.17.5.
swift to anger, AP 9.524.20.
Hsch. s.v. ἀργιμήτας.

quickly dying, short-lived, κλέος A. Ag. 486 (lyr.): also τᾰχῠ-μόριος, Keil-Premerstein Zweiter Bericht No. 264 ( Phrygia, iii A.D.): and τᾰχῠ-μοιρος, Epigr.Gr. 365 ( Cotiaeum), 367 (ibid.), Supp.Epigr. 6.159.17 ( Phrygia, iii A.D.).
speaking fast, Nonn. D. 21.276; φωνή ib. 37.319.
sail fast, Th. 6.31, 34, Plb. 1.23.9, al.; νῆες ταχυναυτοῦσαι Aeschin. 3.97; [ τριήρεις] -οῦσαι IG 2(2).1623.284 (iv B.C.).

make quickly, κοιλὴν κάπετον χερσὶ ταχύνατε S. Aj. 1404 (anap.); ὡς δύνασαι . . ταχύνας σπεῦσον κοιλὴν κάπετον ib. 1164 (anap.); τάδε τοί με σπερχόμενος ταχύνει such are the words by which he urging hastens me, i.e. urges me to hasten, E. Alc. 257 (lyr.):— Pass., σελὶς ταχυνομένη quickly written, AP 6.227 ( Crin.).

children.label: II
children.definition: to be quick, make haste, hurry, A. Pers. 692, Ch. 660, S. OT 861, OC 219 (lyr.), Ar. Ec. 582: in Prose, X. Cyr. 8.5.15: c. gen., τοῦ ποιῆσαι LXX Ge. 18.7.
to be early, ταχύνουσαν ἢ βραδύνουσαν ἀκμὴν προδιαγνῶναι Gal. 19.201.
soon affected, χυμός Choerob.Rh.p.247 S.
soon persuaded, credulous, Theoc. 2.138, 7.38, Nonn. D. 22.79.

children.label: II
children.definition: obeying quickly or easily, ἀνέμων ῥιπή Tryph. 528.

definition: ταχυπέτης, ες, or τᾰχῠ-πετής, ές, ( πέτομαι)

children.definition: flying fast, Suid. s.v. ὠκύπτερον.
sail fast, Plb. 3.95.6.
swiftness in sailing, Poll. 1.106.
fast-sailing, E. Hyps.Fr. 1 iii 12, Sch. Od. 15.473, Hsch. s.v. ὠκύπλους.
breathe quickly, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.96.
quickness of respiration, Hp. Oss. 13, Aët. 13.23.
quick-sailing, διωγμοί A. Supp. 1046 (lyr.).
fast-going, quick of motion, Α. Ag. 486, E. El. 451; τ. κώπη Id. Hel. 1272 (all lyr.); τ. φυγή Tim. Pers. 175; τ. σιδήρια Hp. Art. 11 ( Comp.); of foods, passing rapidly, Gal. 6.535.
Pi. O. 1.66; Ἀνάγκα Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 34.9, cf. IG 14.2005, Nonn. D. 48.11.

definition: ταχύπους, ποδος, ὁ, ἡ, πουν, τό,

children.definition: swift-footed, E. Ba. 782, Ar. Eq. 1068; ἴχνος E. Tr. 232 (anap.); κῶλον Id. Ba. 168 (lyr.).
with swift heels, swift-footed, ἵπποι Thgn. 551.
moult quickly, Aristaenet. 2.1 (better ταχὺ πτ-).
swift winged, πνοαί A. Pr. 88.
with fleet, swift horses, epithet of the Greeks, Δαναοὶ τ. Il. 4.232, al. (never in Od.); Τυνδαρίδη Theoc. 22.136.
swift-rushing, λόγοι A. Th. 286.
swiftly-flowing, Hsch. s.v. ἀψορρόου, Sch. Il. 18.399.
swift-rushing, swift-flying, πελειάς S. OC 1081 (lyr.).

children.label: I
children.definition: swift, fleet, opp. βραδύς,

Il. 18.69, etc.; or more fully, πόδας ταχύς 13.249, 482, 17.709, etc.; ταχὺς ἔσκε θέειν Od. 17.308; θείειν τ. Il. 16.186, Od. 3.112; κύνες, ἔλαφος, πτώξ, ἵππος, Il. 3.26, 8.248, 17.676, 23.347, etc.; οἰωνόν, ταχὺν ἄγγελον 24.292, cf. Od. 15.526; τ. βαδιστής a quick walker, E. Med. 1182; σφοδροὶ καὶ τ. X. Cyr. 2.1.31.

τ. πόδες Il. 6.514, cf. Od. 13.261, etc.; τ. ἰός, ὀϊστοί, Il. 4.94, Od. 22.3, etc.; πτερά Ar. Av. 1453; -ύτατα ἅρματα Pi. O. 1.77; νῆες, τριήρεις, Hdt. 8.23, Th. 6.43, etc.; [ ἴχνος] τὸ τοῦ ποδὸς μὲν βραδύ, τὸ τοῦ δὲ νοῦ ταχύ E. Ion 742.

data.quote: ἴχνος] τὸ τοῦ ποδὸς μὲν βραδύ, τὸ τοῦ δὲ νοῦ ταχύ

children.label: II
children.definition: quick, hasty, φρονεῖν γὰρ οἱ ταχεῖς οὐκ ἀσφαλεῖς S. OT 617: c. inf., βλάπτειν τ. Ar. Ra. 1428; τ. βουλεῦσαί τι ἀνήκεστον Th. 1.132, cf. 118, Luc. Dem.Enc. 12; also τ. πρὸς ὀργήν Plu. Cat.Mi. 1; τὸ ταχύ speed, haste, E. Ph. 452, X. Eq. 7.18, etc.

data.quote: φρονεῖν γὰρ οἱ ταχεῖς οὐκ ἀσφαλεῖς

children.definition: rapid, sudden, πήδημα S. Aj. 833; ᾅδης, μόρος, E. Hipp. 1047, Mosch. 3.26; πόλεμος Th. 4.55, 6.45; φυγή Id. 4.44; μεταβολή Pl. R. 553d; short, τ. ἐλπίδες fleeting hopes, Pi. P. 1.83; ἐπαυρέσεις Th. 2.53; ἀτραπός Ar. Ra. 127; ταχεῖ σὺν χρόνῳ S. OC 1602; τ. διήγησις short, rapid, Arist. Rh. 1416b30.

children.label: B
children.definition: Adv.,
τᾰχέως, quickly, opp. βραδέως, Il. 23.365, Hes. Th. 103, etc.:—rarely in sense perhaps (cf. τάχα II), Plb. 16.25.8.
Adv. is also expressed by periphr., διὰ ταχέων in haste, Th. 1.80, 3.13, Pl. Ap. 32d, X. An. 1.5.9; ἐκ ταχείας S. Tr. 395; cf. τάχος II.

ταχύ as Adv., Pi. P. 10.51, N. 1.51, S. Ph. 349, E. HF 885 (lyr.), Ar. Eq. 109, Gal. 16.665, etc.; ἤδη ἤδη τ. τ. Sammelb. 4321.21, BGU 956.3 (both iii A.D.); ἄρτι ἄρτι τ. τ. Arch.Pap. 5.393 (ii A.D.); also τάχα (q.v.).

Adj. ταχύς is freq. construed with Verbs, where we should use the Adv., ταχέες δʼ ἱππῆες ἄγερθεν Il. 23.287; ταχεῖά γʼ ἦλθε χρησμῶν πρᾶξις A. Pers. 739; ὁρμάσθω ταχύς S. Ph. 526; δεῦρʼ ἀφίξεται τ. Id. OC 307; τ. χάρις διαρρεῖ Id. Aj. 1266, cf. Th. 2.75, 5.66.

children.label: I
children.definition: Comp.:

τᾰχύτερος, α, ον, is used by Hdt., ἐποίησα ταχύτερα ἢ σοφώτερα 3.65, cf. 7.194; also in Arist. Mu. 394b3, Arr. Ind. 9.6, Aret. SD 1.16, but not in good Att.; ταχύτερον as Adv., Hdt. 4.127, 9.101, Hp. Prog. 17.

θάσσων, neut. θᾶσσον, gen. ονος, Att. θάττων, neut. θᾶττον, Il. 15.570, 13.819 (elsewh. only neut. in Hom.), etc.:—neut. as Adv., freq. in Hom., Od. 2.307, al.; θᾶσσον ἂν . . κλύοιμι sooner, i.e. rather, would I hear, S. Ph. 631; θᾶσσον also often stands for the Positive, Il. 2.440, Od. 15.201, 16.130, Pi. P. 4.181, Ar. Nu. 506, V. 187, Ra. 94; οὐ θᾶσσον οἴσεις; i.e. make haste and bring, S. Tr. 1183, cf. OT 430; θᾶττον νοήματος quicker than thought, X. Mem. 4.3.13, cf. Ar. V. 824, etc.; with a Conj., ὅτι θᾶσσον, like ὅτι τάχιστα, Theoc. 24.48; ἐπειδὴ θᾶττον συνεσκότασεν as soon as . . , D. 54.5; ἐπειδὰν θ. συνιῇ τις Pl. Prt. 325c; ὅταν θ. φθέγγηται ὁ κόκκυξ Arist. HA 563b17, cf. 611a5; ἐὰν or ἢν θ. as soon as . . , X. Cyr. 3.3.20, An. 6.5.20, Pl. Alc. 1.105a; ἂν θ. Men. Pk. 174; εἰ θ. Pl. Ep. 324b; ὡς θ. Plb. 1.66.1, 3.82.1; θ. rarely = sooner than, before, ἐξήλαυνον μεσημβρίας οὐ πολλῷ τινι θ. Aristid. Or. 51 ( 27). 13 (cf. τάχιον infr. 3).

ταχίων [ῑ], neut. ιον, is freq. in late Prose, as LXX Wi. 13.9, 1 Ma. 2.40, Ph. Bel. 69.14, 17, 73.23, Gem. 1.20, D.H. 6.42, D.S. 20.6, J. (v. infr.), Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.240d, Ev.Jo. 20.4, Alciphr. 3.4; also in Hp. Mul. 1.1, Men. 402.16; but condemned by Phryn. 58, Hdn. Philet. p.436 P.; τὴν ταχίονα τῆς τροφῆς παράθεσιν earlier, sooner, Gal. 19.206:— Adv. τάχιον earlier, πλέεται . . περὶ τὸν Σεπτέμβριον μῆνα . . , οὐδὲν δὲ κωλύει κἂν τ. Peripl.M.Rubr. 24; τ. τῆς ὑποσχέσεως sooner than they had promised, Rev.Ét.Gr. 6.159 ( Iasus); τ. τοῦ παραγγέλματος J. BJ 4.4.2; εἰς μακρὸν αὐτῶν γῆρας καὶ βίου μῆκος ὅμοιον τοῖς τ. ἐπερχομένων Id. AJ 1.3.7; ἀποπαύεται οὔτε τ. ἐτῶν τεσσαράκοντα οὔτε βράδιον ἐτῶν πεντήκοντα Sor. 1.20, cf. 48, al.; formerly, ἐπεσκεύασαν τὸ παρόχιον, . . τ. γενόμενον γυμνάσιον IGRom. 3.639 ( Lycia, ii A.D.), cf. 4.1517 ( Sardis), 1632.14 ( Philadelphia), 1665.5 ( Tira), Keil-Premerstein Dritter Bericht p.79 (iii A.D.), Hermes 63.229 ( Callatis); cf. supr. 2 fin.

data.quote: εἰς μακρὸν αὐτῶν γῆρας καὶ βίου μῆκος ὅμοιον τοῖς τ. ἐπερχομένων
ἀποπαύεται οὔτε τ. ἐτῶν τεσσαράκοντα οὔτε βράδιον ἐτῶν πεντήκοντα
ἐπεσκεύασαν τὸ παρόχιον, . . τ. γενόμενον γυμνάσιον

children.label: II
children.definition: Sup.:
ταχύτατος is rare, ταχύτατα ἅρματα Pi. O. 1.77; ταχύτατα as Adv., X. HG 5.1.27 codd., Antiph. 87 codd.; but both passages have been corrected.

τάχιστος, η, ον, used by Hom. only in neut. pl. τάχιστα as Adv., most quickly, most speedily, ὅττι τάχιστα as soon as may be, as soon as possible, Il. 4.193, 9.659, al.; ὅτι τάχιστα S. OT 1341 (lyr.), Th. 3.31, etc.; so ὅσον τ. A. Ch. 772, S. OT 1436, etc.; ᾳ (prob.) τ. Pi. O. 13.79; ὅπως τ. A. Ag. 605, S. OT 1410, Ar. V. 167; ὡς τ. IG 1(2).76.23, Hdt. 1.210, Th. 4.15, E. Rh. 147, X. An. 1.3.14: these are ellipt. phrases, as may be seen from the foll. examples, ὡς δυνατόν ἐστι τάχιστα Pl. Lg. 710b, X. Cyr. 5.4.3; ᾗ δυνατὸν τ. Id. HG 6.3.6; ὡς or ᾗ ἠδύνατο τ. Id. Cyr. 3.2.14, An. 1.2.4; ὡς δύναιτο τ. Hdt. 1.79; ὡς or ᾗ ἂν δύνωμαι τ. X. HG 4.1.38, Cyr. 7.1.9, cf. IG 1(2).106.18.

children.label: b
children.definition: τάχιστα after Particles of Time, as soon as, ἐπεὶ ( Ion. ἐπεί τε) τάχιστα A. Pr. 201, Hdt. 1.27, 75, 7.163, X. An. 7.2.6, PCair.Zen. 34.12 (iii B.C.); ἐπειδὴ τ. Pl. Prt. 310d, Is. 9.3, D. 27.16, etc.; ἐπεὰν τ. Hdt. 4.134, 7.129, 8.144; ἐπὰν τ. X. An. 4.6.9; ἐπειδὰν τ. Id. Cyr. 1.3.14, An. 3.1.9; ὅταν τ. Id. Cyr. 4.5.33: also ὡς τ. separated by one or more words, ὡς ἡμέρη τ. ἐγεγόνεε Hdt. 1.11, cf. 19, 47, 65, al., X. Cyr. 1.3.2, Mem. 1.2.16, al.; ὡς δὲ τ. ἐξῆλθε . . κόρον ἔτεκε IG 42(1).121.4 ( Epid., iv B.C.); ὡς γὰρ τ. εἰσῆλθον Men. Pk. 287; ὡς ἂν τ. λάβῃς τὴν ἐπιστολήν PCair.Zen. 241.1 (iii B.C.); but ὡς τ. γὰρ ἀπεδήμησας ib. 472.7 (iii B.C.); ὅπως τ. A. Pr. 230:—the same notion is sometimes expressed by the part., ἀπαλλαγεὶς τάχιστα, = ὡς ἀπηλλάγη τ., Plu. Dem. 8, cf. 25.

data.quote: ὡς δὲ τ. ἐξῆλθε . . κόρον ἔτεκε
ὡς ἂν τ. λάβῃς τὴν ἐπιστολήν

children.definition: τὴν ταχίστην (in full, τὴν τ. ὁδόν X. An. 1.2.20, Luc. Rh.Pr. 4) as Adv., by the quickest way, i.e. most quickly, Hdt. 1.24, 73, 81, 86, Hyp. Eux. 7, Men. Pk. 75, Plb. 1.33.4, etc. (Cf. Lith. (dial.) deñgti, Lett. diêgt, both = ‘run quickly’, Polish dążyć ‘hurry’.)
quickly turning, χορείη Nonn. D. 45.273, cf. 48.165.
quickly productive of children, -όταται μίξεις Aët. 16.26.

definition: ταχυτής, ῆτος, Dor. τᾰχυ-τάς, ᾶτος, ἡ (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 1.83),

children.definition: quickness, swiftness, of dogs, Od. 17.315; ταχυτῆτος ἄεθλα, of the race, Il. 23.740; τ. ποδῶν Xenoph. 2.1, 17, Pi. O. 1.95; ἥσσων ἐς ταχυτῆτα Hdt. 3.102, cf. Anaxag. 9, Archyt. 1, Pl. La. 192a, Arist. Mete. 342a5; of persons, hastiness, Id. EN 1150b27.
quickly bringing forth. Arist. Pr. 891b25.
quickly perishing, short-lived, ἥβη Nonn. D. 7.31; ἀνεμώνη ib. 11.237.
healing quickly, of fractures, Hp. Mochl. 38, in neut. pl. ταχύφυα (leg. ταχυφυᾶ).
fast-speaking, Adam. 2.56, Polem.Phgn. 2.67.
quick-lipped, αὐλοὶ τ. flutes or pipes over which the lips run rapidly, AP 5.205 ( Leon.).
quick of hand, nimble, Critias 55.
quickness of hand, dexterity, Phryn. PS p.111 B., Poll. 2.148.

definition: τάων [ᾱ], Ep. gen. pl. fem. of ὁ, ἡ, τό.

children.definition: peacock-coloured, i.e. shot with various hues, ἱμάτια Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 158.33.
of a peacock, πτερά Luc. VH 2.22.

definition: τάως τέως, Κρῆτες, Hsch.: cf. ἅως.

ταώς, or τᾰῶς, ὁ, Ar. Av. 102, 269, Arist. HA 488b24, al.; gen. ταώ or ταῶ Alex. 100.14, Inscr.Délos 290.4 (iii B.C.); acc. ταών or ταῶν Eup. 36: pl., nom. ταῴ Arist. HA 564a31; ταοί Menodot. ap. Ath. 14.655a; gen. ταῶν Antiph. 205; acc. ταώς or ταῶς Id. 175.5:—but also nom. ταών Aesop. 397b; gen. ταῶνος Arist. HA 559b29, Gal. 6.701, Gp. 14.7.28; dat. ταῶνι Ar. Av. 884: pl., nom. ταῶνες v.l. in Arist. HA 564a31; gen. ταώνων LXX 3 Ki. 10.22; dat. ταῶσι Ar. Ach. 63; acc. ταῶνας Com.Adesp. 59, Plu. Per. 13:—the form ταός is non-existent acc. to Hdn.Gr. ap. Choerob. in Theod. 1.284 H.:—

children.definition: peacock, Pavo cristatus, ll. cc.: metaph. of coxcombs, Ar. Ach. l.c., cf. Stratt. 27, Luc. Nigr. 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Plin. HN 37.187.

children.label: III
children.definition: Philostr. VA 3.1. (Acc. to Trypho ap. Ath. 9.397e, the Athenians pronounced it with an aspirate, ταὧς λέγουσιν Ἀθηναῖοι τὴν τελευταίαν συλλαβὴν περισπῶντες καὶ δασύνοντες; the bird was a native of India ( ταῶς ἐξ Ἰνδίας Luc. Nav. 23); hence ταὧς and Lat. pavus, pavo, perh. also Hebr. tukkîyîm ‘peacocks’, may be borrowed from the same oriental source.)

definition: τε, enclitic Particle, with two main uses (v. infr. A, B).

children.label: I
children.definition: τε . . τε, both . . and, joining single words, phrases, clauses, or sentences, the first τε merely pointing forward to the second, ἀνδρῶν τε θεῶν τε Il. 1.544; ἀγαθῶν τε κακῶν τε Hes. Op. 669; δίψῃ τε λιμῷ τε A. Pers. 491, cf. S. Aj. 34, 35, Ar. Ach. 370, 375; τήν τε νῆσον τήν τε ἤπειρον Th. 4.8, cf. Antipho 2.3.3, Pl. R. 373b; λυσόμενός τε θύγατρα, φέρων τʼ ἀπερείσιʼ ἄποινα Il. 1.13; παῖδά τε σοὶ ἀγέμεν Φοίβῳ θʼ ἱερὴν ἑκατόμβην ῥέξαι ib. 443; the elements joined by τε . . τε are usu. short in Hom., longer in later Gr., e.g. ἐπειδὴ πρόξενοί τέ εἰσιν Ἀθηναίων καὶ εὐεργέται . . , ἔν τε τῇ στήλῃ γέγραπται IG 1(2).103.7; ἥ τε γὰρ γῆ . . εὔυδρός ἐστι, ποταμοί τε διʼ αὐτῆς ῥέουσι Hdt. 4.47; χρὴ . . τούς τε πρεσβυτέρους ὁμοιωθῆναι τοῖς πρὶν ἔργοις, τούς τε νεωτέρους . . μὴ αἰσχῦναι κτλ. Th. 4.92, cf. Pl. R. 474c, X. Cyr. 1.4.25, Is. 1.50; τά τε γὰρ ληφθέντα πάντʼ ἂν σῴζοιτο οἵ τʼ ἀδικήσαντες κατʼ ἀξίαν λάβοιεν τὰ ἐπιτίμια Aen. Tact. 16.8, cf. Gp. 2.49.1, 12.3.2-3; τούτου γὰρ γενομένου . . τά τε ἐχφόρια χρυσέρμῳ δυνήσομαι ἀποδοῦναι, ἐγώ τε ἔσομαι παρὰ σοῦ φιλανθρωπίας τετευχώς PEnteux. 60.11 (iii B.C.); κλείειν τε τὰ βλέφαρα δεομένων ἐλπιζόντων τε κοιμηθήσεσθαι Gal. 16.494, cf. 495,501; this use is common at all times in οὔτε . . οὔτε, μήτε . . μήτε, εἴτε . . εἴτε (qq.v.); τε may be used three or more times, ἔν τʼ ἄρα οἱ φῦ χειρί, ἔπος τʼ ἔφατʼ ἔκ τʼ ὀνόμαζεν Od. 15.530, cf. Il. 1.177, 2.58, A. Pr. 89 sq., B. 17.19 sq., Lys. 19.17, X. Cyr. 3.3.36:— ἑνδεκάτη τε δυωδεκάτη τε prob. means the eleventh or twelfth, Od. 2.374, 4.588:—sts. τε . . τε couples alternatives, ἀπόρως εἶχε δοῦναί τε μὴ δοῦναί τε E. IA 56, cf. Heracl. 153, El. 391; hence we find τε . . ἢ . . , Pl. Tht. 143c, Ion 535d; on ἢ (or ἦ) . . τε in Il. 2.289 and A. Eu. 524 (lyr.) v. ἦ I.3.

data.quote: τήν τε νῆσον τήν τε ἤπειρον
λυσόμενός τε θύγατρα, φέρων τʼ ἀπερείσιʼ ἄποινα
ἐπειδὴ πρόξενοί τέ εἰσιν Ἀθηναίων καὶ εὐεργέται . . , ἔν τε τῇ στήλῃ γέγραπται
ἥ τε γὰρ γῆ . . εὔυδρός ἐστι, ποταμοί τε διʼ αὐτῆς ῥέουσι
τούτου γὰρ γενομένου . . τά τε ἐχφόρια χρυσέρμῳ δυνήσομαι ἀποδοῦναι, ἐγώ τε ἔσομαι παρὰ σοῦ φιλανθρωπίας τετευχώς
κλείειν τε τὰ βλέφαρα δεομένων ἐλπιζόντων τε κοιμηθήσεσθαι
ἔν τʼ ἄρα οἱ φῦ χειρί, ἔπος τʼ ἔφατʼ ἔκ τʼ ὀνόμαζεν
ἀπόρως εἶχε δοῦναί τε μὴ δοῦναί τε

children.definition: ἐκκλησίαν τε οὐκ ἐποίει . . , τήν τε πόλιν ἐφύλασσε Th. 2.22; but οὔτε . . τε is more freq., as οὔτε ποσίν εἰμι ταχύς . . , γιγνώσκω τε X. Cyr. 2.3.6 (v. οὔτε II.4); we also find οὐ . . τε . . , as οὐχ ἡσύχαζον . . , παρεκάλουν τε τοὺς ξυμμάχους Th. 1.67; and μὴ . . τε . . , as ἵνα μή τι διαφύγῃ ἡμᾶς, εἴ τέ τι βούλει κτλ. Pl. Phd. 95e.

data.quote: ἐκκλησίαν τε οὐκ ἐποίει . . , τήν τε πόλιν ἐφύλασσε
οὔτε ποσίν εἰμι ταχύς . . , γιγνώσκω τε
οὐχ ἡσύχαζον . . , παρεκάλουν τε τοὺς ξυμμάχους

children.definition: τε ( both) sts. corresponds to a following δέ ( and), or τε ( and) to a preceding μέν, e.g.

children.label: a
children.definition: τε . . δὲ . . , as κόμισαί τέ με, δὸς δέ μοι ἵππους Il. 5.359, cf. 7.418, S. OC 367, Tr. 285, E. Ph. 1625; ἐσθὰς ἀμφότερόν νιν ἔχεν, ἅ τε . . ἐπιχώριος . . , ἀμφὶ δὲ παρδαλέᾳ στέγετο Pi. P. 4.80; διήκουέ τε . . , ἔπειτα δὲ καὶ ἐπῄνεσε X. Cyr. 4.4.3; so with ἅμα δὲ καὶ . . , ὡσαύτως δὲ καὶ . . , Th. 1.25, Pl. Smp. 186e:—so τε . . , ἀτὰρ οὖν καὶ . . , Id. Hp.Ma. 295e.

data.quote: κόμισαί τέ με, δὸς δέ μοι ἵππους
ἐσθὰς ἀμφότερόν νιν ἔχεν, ἅ τε . . ἐπιχώριος . . , ἀμφὶ δὲ παρδαλέᾳ στέγετο
διήκουέ τε . . , ἔπειτα δὲ καὶ ἐπῄνεσε

children.label: b
children.definition: μὲν . . τε . . , ἄνδρα μὲν . . , τρεῖς τε κασιγνήτους Il. 19.291-3, cf. Od. 22.475-6, Pi. O. 6.88, 7.88, A. Th. 924, Ch. 585 (lyr.), S. Ant. 963 (lyr.), E. Heracl. 337 codd., Cyc. 41 (lyr.), Ar. Nu. 563 (lyr.), Pl. Phdr. 266c, Lg. 927b: v. μέν A. II.6c.

data.quote: μὲν . . τε . . , ἄνδρα μὲν . . , τρεῖς τε κασιγνήτους

children.definition: τε ( and) joins a word, phrase, or (esp. later) clause or sentence to what precedes, τελευτὴν κεφαλήν τε Pl. Ti. 69a; θνητὰ ἀθάνατά τε ib.c; Ζεῦ ἄλλοι τε θεοί Il. 6.476; κύνεσσιν οἰωνοῖσί τε πᾶσι I.5; ῥίγησέν τʼ ἂρ ἔπειτα ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν Ἀγαμέμνων v.l. for δʼ ἂρ in 11.254; ἕν τε οὐδὲν κατέστη ἴαμα . . , σῶμά τε αὔταρκες ὂν οὐδὲν διεφάνη . . , Th. 2.51; τά τε ἱερὰ . . νεκρῶν πλέα ἦν . . ib. 52; νόμοι τε πάντες ξυνεταράχθησαν ibid.; δάκνει σʼ ἀδελφὸς ὅ τε θανὼν ἴσως πατήρ E. El. 242, cf. 253, 262, al.; εἴς τε τὰς ἄλλας . . ἀθροίζεσθαι Aen.Tact. 3.5; τῶν τε ἀρχόντων . . ib. 6, cf. 10.8, al.; ὅ τε γραφεὶς κύκλος . . Archim. Spir. 11 Def. 7; πρός τε τούτοις φησὶν . . PEnteux. 63.18 (iii B.C.); χωρίς τε τούτων Plb. 2.56.13, 61.1, 3.17.7; ταῦτά τʼ ἐγίνετο . . Id. 2.43.6, cf. 3.70.4; ἀπαιτούμενός τε ὑπʼ ἐμοῦ τὰ ἔρια οὐκ ἀποδίδωσί PEnteux. 2.6, cf. 8.4, al. (iii B.C.); γράψαι Ἀγαθοκλεῖ τῷ ἐπιστάτῃ διασαφῆσαί τε αὐτῷ ib. 81.21 (iii B.C.); καθόλου τε . . Arr. Epict. 1.19.13, cf. 2.2.17; ἀταράχους τήν τε δύναμιν ἀκαθαιρέτους Sor. 1.21, cf. 24, al.; ὄξει βαφικῷ στυπτηρίᾳ τε PHolm. 1.4, cf. Gem. 16.6; χρὴ . . λαχάνων ἅπτεσθαι, κοιλίαν τε λύειν Gp. 1.12.19, cf. 2.2.2, al.; this τε may be used any number of times, Od. 4.149- 150, 14.75, 158-9, Men. Pk. 15, 16, 20, Hipparch. 1.9.8, Act.Ap. 2.43, 46, 4.13, 14, al.

data.quote: δάκνει σʼ ἀδελφὸς ὅ τε θανὼν ἴσως πατήρ
ἀπαιτούμενός τε ὑπʼ ἐμοῦ τὰ ἔρια οὐκ ἀποδίδωσί
χρὴ . . λαχάνων ἅπτεσθαι, κοιλίαν τε λύειν

children.label: II
children.definition: τε . . καὶ . . , or τε καὶ . . , both . . and . . , where τε points forward to καί, and usu. need not be translated, e.g. Ἀτρείδης τε ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν καὶ δῖος Ἀχιλλεύς Il. 1.7; εἰ δὴ ὁμοῦ πόλεμός τε δαμᾷ καὶ λοιμὸς Ἀχαιούς ib. 61; δειλός τε καὶ οὐτιδανὸς καλεοίμην ib. 293; ζωόν τε καὶ ἀρτεμέα 7.308, cf. 327, 338, al.; τῆς τε γῆς ἐούσης ἐπιτηδέης καὶ τῶν ποταμῶν ἐόντων σφι συμμάχων Hdt. 4.47; βούλεταί τε καὶ ἐπίσταται Th. 2.35; ὁ φύς τε καὶ τραφείς Pl. R. 396c; βάσιν τε γὰρ πάλιν τὴν αὐτὴν ἔχουσι τὴν ΖΒ καὶ . . Euc. 1.47; sts. the elements joined by τε . . καὶ . . are joined in order to be compared or contrasted rather than simply joined, κάκιστος νῦν τε καὶ πάλαι δοκεῖ S. Ant. 181; μεσαμβρίη τέ ἐστι καὶ τὸ κάρτα γίνεται ψυχρόν Hdt. 4.181; ἔτυχόν τε ὕσταται ἐξαναχθεῖσαι καί κως κατεῖδον Id. 7.194; ἐπαύσατό τε ὁ ἄνεμος καὶ τὸ κῦμα ἔστρωτο ib. 193; ταὐτὰ . . νῦν τε καὶ τότε Ar. Av. 24; χωρὶς τό τʼ εἰπεῖν πολλὰ καὶ τὰ καίρια S. OC 808; ὅσον τό τʼ ἄρχειν καὶ τὸ δουλεύειν δίχα A. Pr. 927; sts. (like τε . . τε) even used of alternatives, διάνδιχα μερμήριξεν, ἵππους τε στρέψαι καὶ ἐναντίβιον μαχέσασθαι Il. 8.168; ἐν δίκᾳ τε καὶ παρὰ δίκαν Pi. O. 2.16; θεοῦ τε . . θέλοντος καὶ μὴ θέλοντος A. Th. 427; πείσας τε . . καὶ μὴ τυχών Th. 3.42:—on οἵ τε ἄλλοι καὶ . . , e.g. τοῖς τε ἄλλοις ἅπασι καὶ Λακεδαιμονίοις Isoc. 12.249, and ἄλλως τε καὶ . . , v. ἄλλος II.6, ἄλλως I.3.

data.quote: Ἀτρείδης τε ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν καὶ δῖος Ἀχιλλεύς
τῆς τε γῆς ἐούσης ἐπιτηδέης καὶ τῶν ποταμῶν ἐόντων σφι συμμάχων
βάσιν τε γὰρ πάλιν τὴν αὐτὴν ἔχουσι τὴν ΖΒ καὶ . .
κάκιστος νῦν τε καὶ πάλαι δοκεῖ
μεσαμβρίη τέ ἐστι καὶ τὸ κάρτα γίνεται ψυχρόν
ἔτυχόν τε ὕσταται ἐξαναχθεῖσαι καί κως κατεῖδον
χωρὶς τό τʼ εἰπεῖν πολλὰ καὶ τὰ καίρια
ὅσον τό τʼ ἄρχειν καὶ τὸ δουλεύειν δίχα
διάνδιχα μερμήριξεν, ἵππους τε στρέψαι καὶ ἐναντίβιον μαχέσασθαι
ἐν δίκᾳ τε καὶ παρὰ δίκαν
θεοῦ τε . . θέλοντος καὶ μὴ θέλοντος
τοῖς τε ἄλλοις ἅπασι καὶ Λακεδαιμονίοις

children.definition: τʼ ἠδέ is only Ep., σκῆπτρόν τʼ ἠδὲ θέμιστας Il. 9.99, cf. 1.400, al.; also τε . . , ἰδέ, χαλκόν τε ἰδὲ λόφον 6.469, cf. 8.162.

data.quote: τε . . , ἰδέ, χαλκόν τε ἰδὲ λόφον

children.definition: καὶ . . τε, both . . and . . , is occasionally found, as καὶ μητέρα πατέρα τʼ E. Alc. 646.

children.label: b
children.definition: καὶ . . τε perh. means and . . also in καὶ ναυτικῷ τε ἅμα Th. 1.9; καὶ πρός τε τοὺς Ῥηγίνους Id. 6.44; καὶ αὐτός τε Id. 8.68; v. infr. C. 10.

τε . . τε or τε . . καὶ . . sts. join elements which are not syntactically parallel, esp. a part. and a finite verb, ἰοῖσίν τε τιτυσκόμενοι λάεσσί τʼ ἔβαλλον (for βάλλοντες) Il. 3.80; ἄλλα τε ἐπιφραζόμενος καὶ δὴ καὶ ἐπεπόμφεε Hdt. 1.85; ἀλλῳ τε τρόπῳ πειράζοντες καὶ μηχανὴν προσήγαγον Th. 4.100; τῆς τε ὥρας . . ταύτης οὔσης . . , καὶ τὸ χωρίον . . χαλεπὸν ἦν Id. 7.47, cf. 4.85, 8.81, 95.

data.quote: ἄλλα τε ἐπιφραζόμενος καὶ δὴ καὶ ἐπεπόμφεε
ἀλλῳ τε τρόπῳ πειράζοντες καὶ μηχανὴν προσήγαγον
τῆς τε ὥρας . . ταύτης οὔσης . . , καὶ τὸ χωρίον . . χαλεπὸν ἦν

children.definition: τε becomes rare in later Gr.; it is found about 340 times in LXX, mostly in the Pentateuch and 1- 4 Ma., only 3 times in Ps.; in the NT it is found about 150 times in Act.Ap., 20 times in Ep.Hebr., and very rarely in the other books.

children.label: B
children.definition: Ep. (more rarely in other dactylic verse, v. infr. II) τε stands in general or frequentative statements or in statements of what is well known; such statements are freq. made as justifications of a preceding particular statement or of a preceding exhortation to a particular person or persons; the sense of τε thus approaches that of τοι (cf. τοι and τε in Od. 2.276- 7, and cf. Il. 13.115 with 15.203); although associated with numerous particles and other words of particular types (v. infr.) its meaning remains independent of these and applies to the whole sentence in which it stands: αἶψά τε φυλόπιδος πέλεται κόρος ἀνθρώποισιν Il. 19.221; οὐ γάρ τʼ αἶψα θεῶν τρέπεται νόος αἰὲν ἐόντων Od. 3.147; θεοὶ δέ τε πάντα ἴσασιν 4.379, cf. 5.79, 447, 10.306, 17.485, Il. 9.497, 16.688, 17.176, 21.264; ξυνὸς Ἐνυάλιος καί τε κτανέοντα κατέκτα 18.309, cf. Od. 11.537, Il. 24.526; ἤ τʼ ἔβλητʼ ἤ τʼ ἔβαλʼ ἄλλον 11.410; οὐ μὲν γάρ τε κακὸν βασιλευέμεν Od. 1.392; οἳ φύλλοισιν ἐοικότες ἄλλοτε μέν τε ζαφλεγέες τελέθουσιν . . ἄλλοτε δὲ . . Il. 21.464; ἄλλος γάρ τʼ ἄλλοισιν ἀνὴρ ἐπιτέρπεται ἔργοις Od. 14.228, cf. 8.169, 170, 15.400; τοῦ γάρ τε ξεῖνος μιμνήσκεται ἤματα πάντα, ἀνδρὸς ξεινοδόκου, ὅς κεν φιλότητα παράσχῃ ib. 54, cf. 17.322; ῥεχθὲν δέ τε νήπιος ἔγνω Il. 17.32; παθὼν δέ τε νήπιος ἔγνω Hes. Op. 218; αἰεὶ γάρ τε νεώτεροι ἀφραδέουσιν Od. 7.294; δύσζηλοι γάρ τʼ εἰμὲν ἐπὶ χθονὶ φῦλʼ ἀνθρώπων ib. 307; τοῦ δέ τε πολλοὶ ἐπαυρίσκοντʼ ἄνθρωποι, καί τε πολέας ἐσάωσε Il. 13.733-4; τοῦ μὲν γάρ τε κακοῦ τρέπεται χρὼς ἄλλυδις ἄλλῃ, ἐν δέ τέ οἱ κραδίη στέρνοισι πατάσσει . . , πάταγος δέ τε γίγνετʼ ὀδόντων ib. 279-83; ὀλίγη δέ τʼ ἀνάπνευσις πολέμοιο 18.201; νέῳ δέ τε πάντʼ ἐπέοικεν . . κεῖσθαι 22.71; κατέλεξεν ἅπαντα κήδεʼ ὅσʼ ἀνθρώποισι πέλει, τῶν ἄστυ ἁλώῃ· ἄνδρας μὲν κτείνουσι, πόλιν δέ τε πῦρ ἀμαθύνει, τέκνα δέ τʼ ἄλλοι ἄγουσι, βαθυζώνους τε γυναῖκας 9.592- 4, cf. 22.492, 495, 499; νεμεσσῶμαί γε μὲν οὐδέν· καὶ γάρ τίς τʼ ἀλλοῖον ὀδύρεται ἄνδρʼ ὀλέσασα . . ἢ Ὀδυσῆʼ Od. 19.265; σχέτλιε, καὶ μέν τίς τε χερείονι πείθεθʼ ἑταίρῳ . . , αὐτὰρ ἐγὼ θεός εἰμι 20.45, cf. 23.118, Il. 2.292, 9.632; νῦν δὲ μνησώμεθα δόρπου· καὶ γάρ τʼ ἠΰκομος Νιόβη ἐμνήσατο σίτου κτλ. 24.602 (where a general inference is implied); ὃν Βριάρεων καλέουσι θεοί, ἄνδρες δέ τε πάντες Αἰγαίωνʼ 1.403, cf. 2.814, 5.306, 10.258, 14.290; sts. of repeated action by particular persons, ἄλλοτε μέν τε γόῳ φρένα τέρπομαι Od. 4.102; οὐ μὰ γὰρ Ἀπόλλωνα Διὶ φίλον, ᾧ τε σύ, Κάλχαν, εὐχόμενος . . θεοπροπίας ἀναφαίνεις Il. 1.86; ἡ δὲ . . μʼ αἰεὶ . . νεικεῖ, καί τέ μέ φησι μάχῃ Τρώεσσιν ἀρήγειν ib. 521; μήτηρ γάρ τέ μέ φησι θεά, Θέτις ἀργυρόπεζα, διχθαδίας κῆρας φερέμεν θανάτοιο τέλοσδε 9.410.

data.quote: αἶψά τε φυλόπιδος πέλεται κόρος ἀνθρώποισιν
οὐ γάρ τʼ αἶψα θεῶν τρέπεται νόος αἰὲν ἐόντων
ξυνὸς Ἐνυάλιος καί τε κτανέοντα κατέκτα
ἤ τʼ ἔβλητʼ ἤ τʼ ἔβαλʼ ἄλλον
οὐ μὲν γάρ τε κακὸν βασιλευέμεν
οἳ φύλλοισιν ἐοικότες ἄλλοτε μέν τε ζαφλεγέες τελέθουσιν . . ἄλλοτε δὲ . .
ἄλλος γάρ τʼ ἄλλοισιν ἀνὴρ ἐπιτέρπεται ἔργοις
τοῦ δέ τε πολλοὶ ἐπαυρίσκοντʼ ἄνθρωποι, καί τε πολέας ἐσάωσε
νέῳ δέ τε πάντʼ ἐπέοικεν . . κεῖσθαι
κατέλεξεν ἅπαντα κήδεʼ ὅσʼ ἀνθρώποισι πέλει, τῶν ἄστυ ἁλώῃ· ἄνδρας μὲν κτείνουσι, πόλιν δέ τε πῦρ ἀμαθύνει, τέκνα δέ τʼ ἄλλοι ἄγουσι, βαθυζώνους τε γυναῖκας
νεμεσσῶμαί γε μὲν οὐδέν· καὶ γάρ τίς τʼ ἀλλοῖον ὀδύρεται ἄνδρʼ ὀλέσασα . . ἢ Ὀδυσῆʼ
σχέτλιε, καὶ μέν τίς τε χερείονι πείθεθʼ ἑταίρῳ . . , αὐτὰρ ἐγὼ θεός εἰμι
ὃν Βριάρεων καλέουσι θεοί, ἄνδρες δέ τε πάντες Αἰγαίωνʼ
ἄλλοτε μέν τε γόῳ φρένα τέρπομαι
οὐ μὰ γὰρ Ἀπόλλωνα Διὶ φίλον, ᾧ τε σύ, Κάλχαν, εὐχόμενος . . θεοπροπίας ἀναφαίνεις
μήτηρ γάρ τέ μέ φησι θεά, Θέτις ἀργυρόπεζα, διχθαδίας κῆρας φερέμεν θανάτοιο τέλοσδε

children.definition: τε, e.g. Ἑρμεία, σοὶ γάρ τε μάλιστά γε φίλτατόν ἐστιν ἀνδρὶ ἑταιρίσσαι καί τʼ ἔκλυες ᾧ κʼ ἐθέλῃσθα, βάσκʼ ἴθι . . Il. 24.334; Ἀτρεΐδη, σοὶ γάρ τε μάλιστά γε λαὸς Ἀχαιῶν πείσονται μύθοισι . . , νῦν δʼ ἀπὸ πυρκαϊῆς σκέδασον . . 23.156; δεῦρο δὴ ὄρσο, γρηῢ . . , ἥ τε γυναικῶν δμῳάων σκοπός ἐσσι . . , ἔρχεο Od. 22.395, cf. Il. 17.249.

data.quote: Ἑρμεία, σοὶ γάρ τε μάλιστά γε φίλτατόν ἐστιν ἀνδρὶ ἑταιρίσσαι καί τʼ ἔκλυες ᾧ κʼ ἐθέλῃσθα, βάσκʼ ἴθι . .
Ἀτρεΐδη, σοὶ γάρ τε μάλιστά γε λαὸς Ἀχαιῶν πείσονται μύθοισι . . , νῦν δʼ ἀπὸ πυρκαϊῆς σκέδασον . .
δεῦρο δὴ ὄρσο, γρηῢ . . , ἥ τε γυναικῶν δμῳάων σκοπός ἐσσι . . , ἔρχεο

children.definition: subj. or opt.), in which the fulfilment of the condition stated in the subsidiary or subordinate clause is declared to be generally or always followed by the result stated in the principal clause, either or both clauses may contain τε:

children.label: a
children.definition: τε, ὅς κε θεοῖς ἐπιπείθηται, μάλα τʼ ἔκλυον αὐτοῦ Il. 1.218; ὃς δʼ ἂν ἀμύμων αὐτὸς ἔῃ καὶ ἀμύμονα εἰδῇ, τοῦ μέν τε κλέος εὐρὺ διὰ ξεῖνοι φορέουσι πάντας ἐπʼ ἀνθρώπους, πολλοί τέ μιν ἐσθλὸν ἔειπον Od. 19.333; εἴ περ γὰρ θυμῷ γε μενοινάᾳ πολεμίζειν, ἀλλά τε λάθρῃ γυῖα βαρύνεται . . , βλάβεται δέ τε γούνατʼ ἰόντι Il. 19.165-6; ᾧ μέν κʼ ἀμμείξας δώῃ Ζεὺς τερπικέραυνος, ἄλλοτε μέν τε κακῷ ὅ γε κύρεται ἄλλοτε δʼ ἐσθλῷ 24.530.

data.quote: ὅς κε θεοῖς ἐπιπείθηται, μάλα τʼ ἔκλυον αὐτοῦ
ὃς δʼ ἂν ἀμύμων αὐτὸς ἔῃ καὶ ἀμύμονα εἰδῇ, τοῦ μέν τε κλέος εὐρὺ διὰ ξεῖνοι φορέουσι πάντας ἐπʼ ἀνθρώπους, πολλοί τέ μιν ἐσθλὸν ἔειπον
εἴ περ γὰρ θυμῷ γε μενοινάᾳ πολεμίζειν, ἀλλά τε λάθρῃ γυῖα βαρύνεται . . , βλάβεται δέ τε γούνατʼ ἰόντι
ᾧ μέν κʼ ἀμμείξας δώῃ Ζεὺς τερπικέραυνος, ἄλλοτε μέν τε κακῷ ὅ γε κύρεται ἄλλοτε δʼ ἐσθλῷ

children.label: b
children.definition: τε, λάζετο δʼ ἔγχος . . τῷ δάμνησι στίχας ἀνδρῶν ἡρώων οἷσίν τε κοτέσσεται ὀβριμοπάτρη 5.747; ῥεῖα δʼ ἀρίγνωτος γόνος ἀνέρος ᾧ τε Κρονίων ὄλβον ἐπικλώση Od. 4.207; ἀντί νυ πολλῶν λαῶν ἐστιν ἀνὴρ ὅν τε Ζεὺς κῆρι φιλήσῃ Il. 9.117, cf. 7.298, Od. 6.287, 7.74, 8.547, 18.276; with opt., ἀλλὰ πολὺ πρώτιστος . . ἕλεσκον ἀνδρῶν δυσμενέων ὅ τέ μοι εἴξειε πόδεσσι 14.221: it is prob. that τε has been replaced by κε in the text of Hom. in Il. 1.218, 9.510 (cf. 508), and some other passages in which κε seems to be used, exceptionally, in general relative clauses.

data.quote: λάζετο δʼ ἔγχος . . τῷ δάμνησι στίχας ἀνδρῶν ἡρώων οἷσίν τε κοτέσσεται ὀβριμοπάτρη
ῥεῖα δʼ ἀρίγνωτος γόνος ἀνέρος ᾧ τε Κρονίων ὄλβον ἐπικλώση
ἀντί νυ πολλῶν λαῶν ἐστιν ἀνὴρ ὅν τε Ζεὺς κῆρι φιλήσῃ
ἀλλὰ πολὺ πρώτιστος . . ἕλεσκον ἀνδρῶν δυσμενέων ὅ τέ μοι εἴξειε πόδεσσι

children.label: c
children.definition: τε, ὃς μέν τʼ αἰδέσεται κούρας Διὸς ἆσσον ἰούσας, τὸν δὲ μέγʼ ὤνησαν καί τʼ ἔκλυον εὐχομένοιο Il. 9.508- 9; εἴ περ γάρ τε χόλον γε καὶ αὐτῆμαρ καταπέψῃ, ἀλλά τε καὶ μετόπισθεν ἔχει κότον 1.82- 3.

data.quote: ὃς μέν τʼ αἰδέσεται κούρας Διὸς ἆσσον ἰούσας, τὸν δὲ μέγʼ ὤνησαν καί τʼ ἔκλυον εὐχομένοιο
εἴ περ γάρ τε χόλον γε καὶ αὐτῆμαρ καταπέψῃ, ἀλλά τε καὶ μετόπισθεν ἔχει κότον

children.definition: ὑπόσχωμαι . . κτήματα . . πάντα μάλʼ ὅσσα τʼ Ἀλέξανδρος . . ἠγάγετο Τροίηνδʼ . . δωσέμεν Il. 22.115; πάντων ὅσσα τε γαῖαν ἔπι πνείει τε καὶ ἕρπει 17.447, cf. Od. 18.131, Il. 19.105; βάλλειν ἄγρια πάντα τά τε τρέφει οὔρεσιν ὕλη 5.52, cf. 18.485.

data.quote: ὑπόσχωμαι . . κτήματα . . πάντα μάλʼ ὅσσα τʼ Ἀλέξανδρος . . ἠγάγετο Τροίηνδʼ . . δωσέμεν
πάντων ὅσσα τε γαῖαν ἔπι πνείει τε καὶ ἕρπει
βάλλειν ἄγρια πάντα τά τε τρέφει οὔρεσιν ὕλη

children.definition: ἐπεὶ οὐχ ἱερήϊον οὐδὲ βοείην ἀρνύσθην, ἅ τε ποσσὶν ἀέθλια γίγνεται ἀνδρῶν which are the usual prizes . . , Il. 22.160; ἔργʼ ἀνδρῶν τε θεῶν τε, τά τε κλείουσιν ἀοιδοί Od. 1.338, cf. 3.435, 4.85, 13.410, 14.226, 17.423, Il. 5.332; κύματος ἐξαναδύς, τά τʼ ἐρεύγεται ἤπειρόνδε Od. 5.438; μολπή τʼ ὀρχηστύς τε, τὰ γάρ τʼ ἀναθήματα δαιτός 1.152: similarly in clauses with οἷά τε (πολλά) , κῆτος ἐπισσεύῃ μέγα δαίμων ἐξ ἁλός, οἷά τε πολλὰ τρέφει . . Ἀμφιτρίτη 5.422; οὐ γάρ σʼ οὐδέ . . δαήμονι φωτὶ ἐΐσκω ἄθλων, οἷά τε πολλὰ μετʼ ἀνθρώποισι πέλονται 8.160, cf. 11.364, 14.63, 15.324, 379.

data.quote: ἔργʼ ἀνδρῶν τε θεῶν τε, τά τε κλείουσιν ἀοιδοί
κύματος ἐξαναδύς, τά τʼ ἐρεύγεται ἤπειρόνδε
μολπή τʼ ὀρχηστύς τε, τὰ γάρ τʼ ἀναθήματα δαιτός
οἷά τε (πολλά) , κῆτος ἐπισσεύῃ μέγα δαίμων ἐξ ἁλός, οἷά τε πολλὰ τρέφει . . Ἀμφιτρίτη
οὐ γάρ σʼ οὐδέ . . δαήμονι φωτὶ ἐΐσκω ἄθλων, οἷά τε πολλὰ μετʼ ἀνθρώποισι πέλονται

children.definition: οὐ γάρ τις νήσων ἱππήλατος οὐδʼ εὐλείμων αἵ θʼ ἁλὶ κεκλίαται no one of the islands which lie in the sea (as all islands do, i.e. no island at all), Od. 4.608; ἡμίονον . . ἥ τʼ ἀλγίστη δαμάσασθαι Il. 23.655; ἐσθλὸς ἐὼν γαμβρὸς ἢ πενθερός, οἵ τε μάλιστα κήδιστοι τελέθουσι Od. 8.582; αἰετοῦ οἴματʼ ἔχων . . ὅς θʼ ἅμα κάρτιστός τε καὶ ὤκιστος πετεηνῶν Il. 21.252, cf. 24.294; οὐδέ μιν εἰσοιχνεῦσι κυνηγέται, οἵ τε καθʼ ὕλην ἄλγεα πάσχουσιν Od. 9.120; δικασπόλοι, οἵ τε θέμιστας πρὸς Διὸς εἰρύαται Il. 1.238, cf. Od. 5.67, 101, Il. 1.279, 19.31, 24.415; οἶνός σε τρώει . . , ὅς τε καὶ ἄλλους βλάπτει Od. 21.293, cf. 14.464; πάρφασις, ἥ τʼ ἔκλεψε νόον πύκα περ φρονεόντων Il. 14.217; οἰκωφελίη, ἥ τε τρέφει ἀγλαὰ τέκνα Od. 14.223.

data.quote: ἐσθλὸς ἐὼν γαμβρὸς ἢ πενθερός, οἵ τε μάλιστα κήδιστοι τελέθουσι
αἰετοῦ οἴματʼ ἔχων . . ὅς θʼ ἅμα κάρτιστός τε καὶ ὤκιστος πετεηνῶν
οὐδέ μιν εἰσοιχνεῦσι κυνηγέται, οἵ τε καθʼ ὕλην ἄλγεα πάσχουσιν
δικασπόλοι, οἵ τε θέμιστας πρὸς Διὸς εἰρύαται
οἶνός σε τρώει . . , ὅς τε καὶ ἄλλους βλάπτει
πάρφασις, ἥ τʼ ἔκλεψε νόον πύκα περ φρονεόντων
οἰκωφελίη, ἥ τε τρέφει ἀγλαὰ τέκνα

children.definition: τε indicates an essential characteristic of the antecedent, Ἐρινύες, αἵ θʼ ὑπὸ γαῖαν ἀνθρώπους τείνυνται Il. 19.259; Σειρῆνας . . , αἵ ῥά τε πάντας ἀνθρώπους θέλγουσιν Od. 12.39; Φαίηκές μʼ ἄγαγον ναυσίκλυτοι, οἵ τε καὶ ἄλλους ἀνθρώπους πέμπουσιν 16.227, cf. 20.187; νυμφάων αἵ τʼ ἄλσεα καλὰ νέμονται καὶ πηγὰς ποταμῶν Il. 20.8; Λωτοφάγων, οἵ τʼ ἄνθινον εἶδαρ ἔδουσι Od. 9.84: similarly when the antecedent is an individual person (incl. god) or thing, the relative clause with τε indicates one of his or its general or essential characteristics or aspects, οὐ μὰ Ζῆνʼ ὅς τίς τε θεῶν ὕπατος καὶ ἄριστος Il. 23.43, cf. 2.669, Od. 5.4; Ἑρμείαο ἕκητι διακτόρου, ὅς ῥά τε πάντων ἀνθρώπων ἔργοισι χάριν καὶ κῦδος ὀπάζει 15.319; Λάμπον καὶ Φαέθονθʼ, οἵ τʼ Ἠῶ πῶλοι ἄγουσι 23.246; Τειρεσίαο μάντιος ἀλαοῦ, τοῦ τε φρένες ἔμπεδοί εἰσι 10.493; τεύχεα δύνεις ἀνδρὸς ἀριστῆος, τόν τε τρομέουσι καὶ ἄλλοι Il. 17.203, cf. 7.112; κεῖται ἀνὴρ ὅν τʼ (v.l. ὃν) ἶσον ἐτίομεν Ἕκτορι δίῳ, Αἰνείας 5.467; the relative clause sts. indicates what is customary, οὐδέ σε λήθω τιμῆς ἧς τέ μʼ ἔοικε τετιμῆσθαι μετʼ Ἀχαιοῖς 23.649; ἔνθα δʼ ἀνὴρ ἐνίαυε πελώριος, ὅς ῥά τε μῆλα οἶος ποιμαίνεσκε Od. 9.187; τῶν πάντων οὐ τόσσον ὀδύρομαι . . ὡς ἑνός, ὅς τέ μοι ὕπνον ἀπεχθαίρει καὶ ἐδωδὴν μνωομένῳ 4.105; σῆς ἀλόχου . . ἥ τέ τοι αὔτως ἧσται ἐνὶ μεγάροισιν 13.336; καὶ κήρυκα Μέδοντα σαώσομεν, ὅς τέ μευ αἰεὶ . . κηδέσκετο 22.357, cf. 346.

data.quote: Ἐρινύες, αἵ θʼ ὑπὸ γαῖαν ἀνθρώπους τείνυνται
Σειρῆνας . . , αἵ ῥά τε πάντας ἀνθρώπους θέλγουσιν
Φαίηκές μʼ ἄγαγον ναυσίκλυτοι, οἵ τε καὶ ἄλλους ἀνθρώπους πέμπουσιν
νυμφάων αἵ τʼ ἄλσεα καλὰ νέμονται καὶ πηγὰς ποταμῶν
Λωτοφάγων, οἵ τʼ ἄνθινον εἶδαρ ἔδουσι
οὐ μὰ Ζῆνʼ ὅς τίς τε θεῶν ὕπατος καὶ ἄριστος
Ἑρμείαο ἕκητι διακτόρου, ὅς ῥά τε πάντων ἀνθρώπων ἔργοισι χάριν καὶ κῦδος ὀπάζει
Λάμπον καὶ Φαέθονθʼ, οἵ τʼ Ἠῶ πῶλοι ἄγουσι
Τειρεσίαο μάντιος ἀλαοῦ, τοῦ τε φρένες ἔμπεδοί εἰσι
τεύχεα δύνεις ἀνδρὸς ἀριστῆος, τόν τε τρομέουσι καὶ ἄλλοι
οὐδέ σε λήθω τιμῆς ἧς τέ μʼ ἔοικε τετιμῆσθαι μετʼ Ἀχαιοῖς
ἔνθα δʼ ἀνὴρ ἐνίαυε πελώριος, ὅς ῥά τε μῆλα οἶος ποιμαίνεσκε
τῶν πάντων οὐ τόσσον ὀδύρομαι . . ὡς ἑνός, ὅς τέ μοι ὕπνον ἀπεχθαίρει καὶ ἐδωδὴν μνωομένῳ
σῆς ἀλόχου . . ἥ τέ τοι αὔτως ἧσται ἐνὶ μεγάροισιν
καὶ κήρυκα Μέδοντα σαώσομεν, ὅς τέ μευ αἰεὶ . . κηδέσκετο

children.definition: τε is used in descriptions of particular places or things when attention is called to their peculiar or characteristic features, or their position, e.g. Λιβύην, ἵνα τʼ ἄρνες ἄφαρ κεραοὶ τελέθουσι Od. 4.85; ἔνθα δέ τʼ ὄρνιθες τανυσίπτεροι εὐνάζοντο 5.65, cf. 9.124, 13.99, 100, 107, 109, 244; ἓξ δέ τέ οἱ (sc. Σκύλλῃ) δειραὶ περιμήκεες 12.90, cf. 93, 99, 105; ἐν δέ τε Γοργείη κεφαλή (in Athenaʼs αἰγίς) Il. 5.741; χαλεπὸν δέ τʼ ὀρύσσειν ἀνδράσι γε θνητοῖσι (sc. μῶλυ) Od. 10.305; δοιαὶ γάρ τε πύλαι ἀμενηνῶν εἰσὶν ὀνείρων 19.562; sts. τε draws attention to a well-known custom or permanent feature, ἀρξάμενοι τοῦ χώρου, ὅθεν τέ περ οἰνοχοεύει 21.142; ἦ μένετε Τρῶας σχεδὸν ἐλθέμεν, ἔνθα τε νῆες εἰρύατʼ εὔπρυμνοι Il. 4.247, cf. Od. 6.266; ἐν ποταμῷ, ὅθι τʼ ἀρδμὸς ἔην πάντεσσι βοτοῖσιν Il. 18.521, cf. Od. 14.353.

data.quote: Λιβύην, ἵνα τʼ ἄρνες ἄφαρ κεραοὶ τελέθουσι
ἔνθα δέ τʼ ὄρνιθες τανυσίπτεροι εὐνάζοντο
δοιαὶ γάρ τε πύλαι ἀμενηνῶν εἰσὶν ὀνείρων
ἀρξάμενοι τοῦ χώρου, ὅθεν τέ περ οἰνοχοεύει
ἦ μένετε Τρῶας σχεδὸν ἐλθέμεν, ἔνθα τε νῆες εἰρύατʼ εὔπρυμνοι
ἐν ποταμῷ, ὅθι τʼ ἀρδμὸς ἔην πάντεσσι βοτοῖσιν

children.definition: τε) which indicates a feature which universally belongs to it, κατʼ ἰσχίον, ἔνθα τε μηρὸς ἰσχίῳ ἐνστρέφεται Il. 5.305, cf. 8.83, 13.547, 16.481, 20.478; similarly a point of time is defined, ὥρῃ ἐν εἰαρινῇ, ὅτε τʼ ἤματα μακρὰ πέλονται Od. 18.367.

data.quote: κατʼ ἰσχίον, ἔνθα τε μηρὸς ἰσχίῳ ἐνστρέφεται
ὥρῃ ἐν εἰαρινῇ, ὅτε τʼ ἤματα μακρὰ πέλονται

children.definition: τε is used in relative clauses which define a measurement of a particular thing or action by reference to the measurement (in general) of some thing or action well known in daily life, γεφύρωσεν δὲ κέλευθον μακρὴν ἠδʼ εὐρεῖαν, ὅσον τʼ ἐπὶ δουρὸς ἐρωὴ γίγνεται Il. 15.358; τοῦ δʼ ἤτοι κλέος ἔσται ὅσον τʼ ἐπικίδναται ἠώς 7.451; ὅτε τόσσον ἀπῆν ὅσσον τε γέγωνε βοήσας Od. 9.473, cf. 3.321, al.; more rarely the definition is by reference to the measurement of a particular thing or action, ἤσθιε . . ἕως ὅ τʼ ἀοιδὸς ἐνὶ μεγάροισιν ἄειδεν (s.v.l.) 17.358; ἥ τις δὴ τέτληκε τόσα φρεσίν, ὅσσα τʼ ἐγώ περ 19.347.

data.quote: γεφύρωσεν δὲ κέλευθον μακρὴν ἠδʼ εὐρεῖαν, ὅσον τʼ ἐπὶ δουρὸς ἐρωὴ γίγνεται
τοῦ δʼ ἤτοι κλέος ἔσται ὅσον τʼ ἐπικίδναται ἠώς
ὅτε τόσσον ἀπῆν ὅσσον τε γέγωνε βοήσας
ἥ τις δὴ τέτληκε τόσα φρεσίν, ὅσσα τʼ ἐγώ περ

children.definition: τε B in similes is to be explained under one or other of the foregoing heads, e.g. when reference is made to generally known kinds of things or natural phenomena, to human experience in daily life, or to well-known phenomena of the animal world, Il. 2.456, 459, 463, 468, 470, 471, 474, 481, 3.23-5, 33, 11.415-17, al.; or when universal characteristics of gods, men, animals, etc., are indicated by relative clauses introduced by ὅς τε, ὅς ῥά τε, etc., 3.61, 151, 198, al.; or by ὥς τε, ἠΰτε, ὥς τίς τε, etc., e.g. 5.136, 17.133, Od. 4.535, ὡς εἴ τε 9.314, 14.254, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom. Gr. this use of τε is more restricted; outside of Ep. and other early dactylic verse ( Hes. Op. 30, 214, 233, al., Xenoph. 13.3, Thgn. 148, 359, etc.) it is not found except with relatives, and with these it has scarcely any discernible sense, so that ὅς τε in Lyr. and Trag. is for the most part only = ὅς, e.g. (possibly generalizing) Μοῖρʼ, ἅ τε πατρώϊον τῶνδʼ ἔχει τὸν εὔφρονα πότμον Pi. O. 2.35, cf. 14.2, A. Eu. 1024, E. Hec. 445 (lyr.), etc. (v. ὅστε); without generalizing force, Pi. N. 9.9, A. Pers. 297, Ch. 615, etc.; Hdt. has τά πέρ τε 1.74, ὅκως τε 2.108 codd., ὅσον τε (without a verb, as in Od. 9.325, al.) 1.126, 2.96, 3.5, al., οἷά τε 1.93 codd. (adverbially 2.175, 5.11): in Att. Prose and Com. even these uses disappear and we find only a few phrases, as ἅτε, ὥστε, ἐφʼ ᾧτε, οἷός τε; in later Gr. we find exceptionally ἔνθεν τε Hp. Ep. 17; ἀφʼ οὗ τε UPZ 62.8 (ii B.C.); ἀπʼ οὗ τε PCair.Zen. 291.3 (iii B.C.); οἵ τε GDI 215.23 ( Erythrae, ii B.C.); ἥ τʼ PMag.Par. 1.2962; ὅσον τε ὀκτὼ στάδια Paus. 6.26.1; καὶ ἔστιν ἔπη Μαντικὰ ὁπόσα τε (= which) ἐπελεξάμεθα καὶ ἡμεῖς Id. 9.31.5; οἷόν τε καὶ ἐπὶ τῆς κύων φωνῆς θεωροῦμεν S.E. M. 11.28.

data.quote: Μοῖρʼ, ἅ τε πατρώϊον τῶνδʼ ἔχει τὸν εὔφρονα πότμον
οἷόν τε καὶ ἐπὶ τῆς κύων φωνῆς θεωροῦμεν

children.label: C
children.definition: Hom. τε is also (but less freq.) used in conjunction with other particles in contexts (mainly particular statements) such as the following:

σχέτλιος, ἦ τʼ ἐκέλευον ἀπωσάμενον δήϊον πῦρ ἂψ ἐπὶ νῆας ἴμεν Il. 18.13; ἐξ αὖ νῦν ἔφυγες θάνατον, κύον· ἦ τέ τοι ἄγχι ἦλθε κακόν 11.362; ἦ τε is similarly used in 11.391, 17.171, 236, Od. 24.28, 311, al.; ἦ τʼ ἄν in Il. 12.69, al.; γάρ τε (s. v.l.) in οὐ γάρ τʼ οἶδα 6.367, cf. Od. 10.190; νύ τε in 1.60, 347 (but τʼ more prob. = τοι, v. σύ) ; δέ τε in ἀγορῇ δέ τʼ ἀμείνονές εἰσι καὶ ἄλλοι Il. 18.106; σὲ δέ τʼ ἐνθάδε γῦπες ἔδονται 16.836; μέν τε in σφὼ μέν τε σαώσετε λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν 13.47, cf. 4.341; εἴ πέρ τε in οὔ τοι ἔτι δηρόν γε φίλης ἀπὸ πατρίδος αἴης ἔσσεται, οὐδʼ εἴ πέρ τε σιδήρεα δέσματʼ ἔχῃσιν Od. 1.204, cf. 188, Il. 12.223, 245.

data.quote: σχέτλιος, ἦ τʼ ἐκέλευον ἀπωσάμενον δήϊον πῦρ ἂψ ἐπὶ νῆας ἴμεν
ἐξ αὖ νῦν ἔφυγες θάνατον, κύον· ἦ τέ τοι ἄγχι ἦλθε κακόν
ἀγορῇ δέ τʼ ἀμείνονές εἰσι καὶ ἄλλοι
σὲ δέ τʼ ἐνθάδε γῦπες ἔδονται
σφὼ μέν τε σαώσετε λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν
οὔ τοι ἔτι δηρόν γε φίλης ἀπὸ πατρίδος αἴης ἔσσεται, οὐδʼ εἴ πέρ τε σιδήρεα δέσματʼ ἔχῃσιν

children.definition: σίγα, μή τίς τʼ ἄλλος Ἀχαιῶν τοῦτον ἀκούσῃ μῦθον Il. 14.90, cf. Od. 19.486; ὣς ἄγαγʼ ὡς μήτʼ ἄρ τις ἴδῃ μήτʼ ἄρ τε νοήσῃ Il. 24.337; τούσδε τʼ (v.l. δʼ) ἐᾶν 16.96 (nisi leg. τούσδʼ ἔτʼ) ; δὸς δέ τέ μʼ ἄνδρα ἑλεῖν 5.118; μηδέ τʼ ἐρώει (nisi leg. μηδʼ ἔτʼ) 2.179, 22.185.

data.quote: σίγα, μή τίς τʼ ἄλλος Ἀχαιῶν τοῦτον ἀκούσῃ μῦθον
ὣς ἄγαγʼ ὡς μήτʼ ἄρ τις ἴδῃ μήτʼ ἄρ τε νοήσῃ
; δὸς δέ τέ μʼ ἄνδρα ἑλεῖν

children.definition: ὤ μοι ἐγὼ δειλή . . ἥ τʼ . . τὸν μὲν . . θρέψασα . . ἐπιπροέηκα Il. 18.55; σχέτλιοί ἐστε, θεοί, ζηλήμονες ἔξοχον ἄλλων, οἵ τε θεαῖς ἀγάασθε . . ἤν τίς τε . . Od. 5.119, 120, cf. 21.87, Il. 15.468, 17.174; ἡμεῖς δʼ αὖ μαχόμεσθʼ, οἵ πέρ τʼ ἐπίκουροι ἔνειμεν and we, who ( mark you) are only allies (not γαμβροί and κασίγνητοι), are fighting, 5.477; τρεῖς γάρ τʼ ἐκ Κρόνου εἰμὲν ἀδελφεοί for we, let me tell you, are three brothers, sons of Cronos (and Zeus has no prior title to power), 15.187; ποῖόν σε ἔπος φύγεν ἕρκος ὀδόντων δεινόν τʼ ἀργαλέον τε· νεμεσσῶμαι δέ τʼ ἀκούων Od. 21.169; οὐ μήν οἱ τό γε κάλλιον οὐδέ τʼ ἄμεινον Il. 24.52.

data.quote: ὤ μοι ἐγὼ δειλή . . ἥ τʼ . . τὸν μὲν . . θρέψασα . . ἐπιπροέηκα
σχέτλιοί ἐστε, θεοί, ζηλήμονες ἔξοχον ἄλλων, οἵ τε θεαῖς ἀγάασθε . . ἤν τίς τε . .
ποῖόν σε ἔπος φύγεν ἕρκος ὀδόντων δεινόν τʼ ἀργαλέον τε· νεμεσσῶμαι δέ τʼ ἀκούων
οὐ μήν οἱ τό γε κάλλιον οὐδέ τʼ ἄμεινον

children.definition: κνίση μὲν ἀνήνοθεν, ἐν δέ τε φόρμιγξ ἠπύει Od. 17.270; ὥς (= so) τέ μοι ὑβρίζοντες ὑπερφιάλως δοκέουσιν δαίνυσθαι κατὰ δῶμα 1.227; τοὺς μέν τʼ ἰητροὶ πολυφάρμακοι ἀμφιπένονται . . σὺ δʼ ἀμήχανος ἔπλευ, Ἀχιλλεῦ Il. 16.28; πόλιν πέρι δινηθήτην καρπαλίμοισι πόδεσσι, θεοὶ δέ τε πάντες ὁρῶντο dub. l. in 22.166; εὗρε δʼ ἐνὶ σπῆϊ γλαφυρῷ Θέτιν, ἀμφὶ δέ τʼ ἄλλαι εἵαθʼ ὁμηγερέες ἅλιαι θεαί 24.83 (s.v.l.); ἐν δέ τε φάρμακον ἧκε Od. 10.317; νῶϊ δέ τʼ ἄψορροι κίομεν Il. 21.456; πολλὰς γὰρ δὴ νύκτας . . ἄεσα καί τʼ ἀνέμεινα . . Ἠῶ Od. 19.342; δέελον δʼ ἐπὶ σῆμά τʼ ἔθηκε Il. 10.466; ἐν δέ τε οἶνον κρητῆρσιν κερόωντο Od. 20.252; so with οὐδέ τʼ (nisi leg. οὐδʼ ἔτʼ) , τὸν καὶ ὑπέδδεισαν μάκαρες θεοὶ οὐδέ τʼ ἔδησαν Il. 1.406; οὐδέ τʼ ἔληγε μέγας θεός, ὦρτο δʼ ἐπʼ αὐτόν 21.248; οὐδέ τʼ ἄειρε 23.730; οὐδέ τʼ ἔασεν 11.437, 21.596, cf. 15.709.

data.quote: κνίση μὲν ἀνήνοθεν, ἐν δέ τε φόρμιγξ ἠπύει
τέ μοι ὑβρίζοντες ὑπερφιάλως δοκέουσιν δαίνυσθαι κατὰ δῶμα
τοὺς μέν τʼ ἰητροὶ πολυφάρμακοι ἀμφιπένονται . . σὺ δʼ ἀμήχανος ἔπλευ, Ἀχιλλεῦ
εὗρε δʼ ἐνὶ σπῆϊ γλαφυρῷ Θέτιν, ἀμφὶ δέ τʼ ἄλλαι εἵαθʼ ὁμηγερέες ἅλιαι θεαί
πολλὰς γὰρ δὴ νύκτας . . ἄεσα καί τʼ ἀνέμεινα . . Ἠῶ
δέελον δʼ ἐπὶ σῆμά τʼ ἔθηκε
ἐν δέ τε οἶνον κρητῆρσιν κερόωντο
τὸν καὶ ὑπέδδεισαν μάκαρες θεοὶ οὐδέ τʼ ἔδησαν
οὐδέ τʼ ἔληγε μέγας θεός, ὦρτο δʼ ἐπʼ αὐτόν

children.definition: ὅτε τε ( when) freq. introduces a temporal clause defining a point of time in the past by means of a well-known event which occurred then, ἦ οὐ μέμνῃ ὅτε τʼ ἐκρέμω ὑψόθεν; Il. 15.18; ὅτε τε Κρόνον . . Ζεὺς γαίης νέρθε καθεῖσε 14.203; ἤματι τῷ ὅτε τʼ ἦλθον Ἀμαζόνες 3.189 (but ἤματι τῷ ὅτε τε is general in 13.335; so also ὅτε πέρ τε . . κέρωνται in 4.259); ὅτε τʼ ἤλυθε νόσφιν Ἀχαιῶν ἄγγελος ἐς Θήβας 5.803, cf. 10.286, 22.102, Od. 7.323, 18.257.

data.quote: ὅτε τε Κρόνον . . Ζεὺς γαίης νέρθε καθεῖσε
ἤματι τῷ ὅτε τʼ ἦλθον Ἀμαζόνες
ὅτε τʼ ἤλυθε νόσφιν Ἀχαιῶν ἄγγελος ἐς Θήβας

children.definition: ὅ τε ( that or because) the τε has no observable meaning, χωόμενος ὅ τʼ ἄριστον Ἀχαιῶν οὐδὲν ἔτισας Il. 1.244, cf. 412, 4.32, 6.126, Od. 5.357, al.

data.quote: χωόμενος ὅ τʼ ἄριστον Ἀχαιῶν οὐδὲν ἔτισας

children.definition: ἐπεί τε = ἐπεί ( when) is rare in Hom., ἐπεί τʼ ἐνόησε Il. 12.393, cf. ἐπείτε.

τʼ ἄρ occurs in questions, e.g. πῇ τʼ ἂρ μέμονας καταδῦναι ὅμιλον; Il. 13.307, cf. 1.8, 18.188, al., ταρ (q.v.) should prob. be read, since ἄρ ( α) usu. precedes a τε which is not copulative; so perh. ταρα should be read for τʼ ἄρα in Od. 1.346.

ἣ θέμις ἐστὶν . . ἤ τʼ ἀνδρῶν ἤ τε γυναικῶν Il. 9.276, it is not clear whether τε is copulative ( τε A) or generalizing ( τε B) or neither ( τε C); ἤ is prob. = ἦ (accented as in ἤτοι ( ; ἤ τʼ ἀλκῆς ἤ τε φόβοιο is dub. l. in 17.42; ἤ τʼ = or is found in 19.148, = than in Od. 16.216.

data.quote: ἣ θέμις ἐστὶν . . ἤ τʼ ἀνδρῶν ἤ τε γυναικῶν

children.label: a
children.definition: also, esp. with ἄλλος, Ἑρμεία, σὺ γὰρ αὖτε τά τʼ ἄλλα περ ἄγγελός ἐσσι Od. 5.29, cf. 17.273, Il. 23.483; ἐπεὶ τά τε ἄλλα πράττουσιν καλῶς, ἀναθεῖναι αὐτοὺς καὶ στήλην IG 2(2).1298.9, cf. Lycurg. 100 (s.v.l.); ἐκομισάμην τὸ παρὰ σοῦ ἐπιστόλιον, ἐν ᾧ ὑπέγραψάς μοι τήν τε παρὰ Ζήνωνος πρὸς Ἰεδδοῦν γεγραμμένην PCair.Zen. 18.1 (iii B.C.); εἰ οὖν περὶ τούτων ἐπιστροφὴν μὴ ποιήσει, οἵ τε λοιποί μοι τὰς χεῖρας προσοίσουσιν ( -σωσιν Pap.) PPetr. 2p.10 (iii B.C.); τῶν δὲ παρὰ ταῦτα ποιησόντων τά τε κτήνη ὑπὸ στέρεσιν ἀχθήσεσθαι πρὸς τὰ ἐκφόρια PTeb. 27.74 (ii B.C.); v. supr. A. II.3b.

data.quote: ἄλλος, Ἑρμεία, σὺ γὰρ αὖτε τά τʼ ἄλλα περ ἄγγελός ἐσσι
ἐπεὶ τά τε ἄλλα πράττουσιν καλῶς, ἀναθεῖναι αὐτοὺς καὶ στήλην
ἐκομισάμην τὸ παρὰ σοῦ ἐπιστόλιον, ἐν ᾧ ὑπέγραψάς μοι τήν τε παρὰ Ζήνωνος πρὸς Ἰεδδοῦν γεγραμμένην
τῶν δὲ παρὰ ταῦτα ποιησόντων τά τε κτήνη ὑπὸ στέρεσιν ἀχθήσεσθαι πρὸς τὰ ἐκφόρια

children.label: b
children.definition: ὅδε, adding a slight emphasis to the preceding word, εἰ δὴ τήνδε τε γαῖαν ἀνείρεαι Od. 13.238, cf. 15.484.

data.quote: εἰ δὴ τήνδε τε γαῖαν ἀνείρεαι

children.label: c
children.definition: τε γάρ rarely = καὶ γάρ or γάρ, Arist. APo. 75b41, de An. 405a4, PA 661b28, Pol. 1318b33, 1333a2; ἐάν τε γάρ for even if, 2 Ep.Cor. 10.8; τήν τε γὰρ ἐπιθυμίαν οὐκ ᾔδειν for I had not known even lust. Ep.Rom. 7.7.

children.label: D
children.definition: τε:

ἐγγύθι τε Πριάμοιο καὶ Ἕκτορος near both Priam and Hector, Il. 6.317; ἡμέτεραί τʼ ἄλοχοι καὶ νήπια τέκνα 2.136, cf. 4.505, 7.295; αἰεί τε δὴ νηλὴς οὺ καὶ θράσους πλέως A. Pr. 42 codd., cf. 291 (anap.); ἄνευ τε δόλου καὶ ἀπάτης Hdt. 1.69; ὑπέρ τε σοῦ καὶ τῆς ἀδελφῆς PEnteux. 6.6 (iii B.C.); τοῖς τε πόνοις καὶ μαθήμασι Pl. R. 537a, cf. Ti. 70b; hence in E. Or. 897 πόλεος must be taken with what precedes (Porson ad loc.): but article + noun, preposition + noun are freq. regarded as forming a unity indivisible by τε, τοῖς κτανοῦσί τε A. Ch. 41 (lyr.); πρὸς βίαν τε Id. Pr. 210; also the order is freq. determined by the meaning, τε being placed immediately after the word (or first word of a phrase or clause) which it joins to what precedes or to what follows, πατὴρ ἀνδρῶν τε θεῶν τε Il. 1.544; ἔξω δόμων τε καὶ πάτρας A. Pr. 665; the copulative or preparatory τε precedes many other particles, e.g. τε γάρ, τʼ ἄρα, τέ τις.

data.quote: ἡμέτεραί τʼ ἄλοχοι καὶ νήπια τέκνα
αἰεί τε δὴ νηλὴς οὺ καὶ θράσους πλέως
ὑπέρ τε σοῦ καὶ τῆς ἀδελφῆς

children.definition: τε is enclitic in signfs. B, C also, and stands early in its sentence, clause, or phrase (v. supr.), but many particles which follow τε in signf. A precede it in signfs. B, C, e.g. in signfs. B, C we have δέ τε, μέν τε, γάρ τε, ἀλλά τε, δʼ ἄρα τε, ὅς ῥά τε, οὔτʼ ἄρ τε, καὶ γάρ τίς τε, ὅς τίς τε, καί τε.

children.label: E
children.definition: ca, Lat. -que; for signfs. B and C cf. Skt. ca in yáḥ káś ca ‘whosoever (with following verb)ʼ, Lat. -que in quisque, ubique, plerique, usque, neque, nec (= non in necopinans, etc.), Goth. ni-h ‘not’ (also ‘and notʼ), Lat. namque (= nam).

definition: τέ, Dor. acc. sg. of σύ (q.v.).
τέʼ, apostroph. for τεά, neut. pl. of τεός, Il. 5.237.
τεαρσιηκις, obscure word (perh. a pr. n.) in Ostr.Strassb. 583 i 3, al. (iii B.C.).
τεβεις, dub. l. in PAmh. 2.39.7 (ii B.C.).
τέγγω, Alc. 39, etc.: fut. τέγξω Pi. O. 4.19, E. Supp. 979 (lyr.): aor. ἔτεγξα B. 5.157, A. Pr. 402 (lyr.), Hp. Nat.Mul. 35:— Pass., aor. ἐτέγχθην S. Ph. 1456 (anap.), Pl. Lg. 880e:—

children.definition: wet, moisten, τέγγε πλεύμονας οἴνῳ Alc. l.c.; ἀκρήτῳ πνεύμονα τεγγόμενος Eratosth. 25; οἴνῳ πνεύμονα τέγγε Poet. ap. Suid. s.v. τέγγε; τέγγει γὰρ [τὸ ἔλαιον] τὸν ξηρὸν χρῶτα Gal. 6.229, cf. 366,560, 15.714; esp. of internal moistening by liquid food, opp. βρέχω (moisten on the surface), Id. 10.808, 12.186 (the word is not freq. in Prose); φάρεα ποταμίᾳ δρόσῳ τ., so as to wash them, E. Hipp. 127 (lyr.); ἐν θαλάττῃ τ. τοὺς πόδας Pl. Lg. 866d:—in Trag. and Lyr. freq. of tears, δάκρυσι κόλπους τέγγουσι A. Pers. 540 (anap.); ἀπʼ ὄσσων παρειὰν νοτίοις ἔτεγξα παγαῖς Id. Pr. 402 (lyr.); ὄμμα δάκρυσιν τ. E. Supp. 21, cf. IA 496; and simply, τ. παρειάν, ὄμμα, S. Ant. 530 (anap.), E. Alc. 764; τέγξαι βλέφαρον B. 5.157:— Pass., to be moistened, δρόσοις S. Aj. 1209 (lyr.); δάκρυσί μου βλέφαρα τ. E. Hipp. 854 (lyr.): τέγγομαι (sc. ὄσσε), i.e. I weep, A. Pers. 1065 (lyr.).

data.quote: ἀπʼ ὄσσων παρειὰν νοτίοις ἔτεγξα παγαῖς

children.definition: τ. δάκρυα shed tears, Pi. N. 10.75; ἁδινῶν χλωρὰν τέγγει δακρύων ἄχναν S. Tr. 848 (lyr.):— Pass., ὄμβρος χάλαζά θʼ αἱματοῦσσʼ ἐτέγγετο a shower fell, Id. OT 1279.
soak, in Pass., distd. from τήκεσθαι, Arist. Mete. 385b22; τέγγει is prob. f.l. for στέγει in Id. Pr. 869b25.

children.label: II
children.definition: soften (properly, by soaking or bathing), ἀοιδαὶ θέλξαν νιν ἁπτόμεναι· οὐδὲ θερμὸν ὕδωρ τόσον γε μαλθακὰ τέγξει (sic Plu. Tranq. 2.467d, τεύχει codd. Pi.) γυῖα (i.e. ὥστε μαλθακὰ γενέσθαι) Pi. N. 4.4:—metaph. in Pass., τέγγει γὰρ οὐδέν thou art no whit softened, A. Pr. 1008; οὔτε γὰρ . . λόγοις ἐτέγγεθʼ ἥδε νῦν τʼ οὐ πείθεται E. Hipp. 303; χωρεῖτʼ ὀργῇ καὶ μὴ τέγγεσθʼ Ar. Lys. 550; ὑπὸ κακοδοξίας τέγγεσθαι Pl. R. 361c, cf. Lg. 880e.

data.quote: οὔτε γὰρ . . λόγοις ἐτέγγεθʼ ἥδε νῦν τʼ οὐ πείθεται

children.label: III
children.definition: dye, stain: metaph., οὐ ψεύδεϊ τέγξω λόγον Pi. O. 4.19. (Cf. Lat. tingo.)

definition: Τεγέα, ας, Ion. Τεγέη, ης, ἡ,

children.definition: Tegea in Arcadia, Il. 2.607, Pi. O. 10(11).66, etc.:— Τεγεάτης [ ᾱ], ου, Ion. Τεγε-ήτης, ὁ, of or from Tegea, Hdt. 1.65, etc.; then, by a play upon words, of or from a brothel (v. τέγος III), Diog.Cyn. ap. D.L. 6.61: fem. Τεγεᾶτις, ιδος, (sc. χώρα) the Tegeate country, Th. 5.65:— Adj. Τεγεᾱτικός, Ion. Τεγε-ητικός, ή, όν, Hdt. 8.124.
at or near the roof, τ. θάλαμοι, of the womenʼs chambers, = ὑπερῷον, Il. 6.248.
roofed, Διὸς τ. δόμοι Emp. 142, and so perh. in Il. l.c., though Apollon. Lex. glosses by ὑπερῷοι.
D.C. 39.61 ( τέγναις codd.), Hsch.
Vett.Val. 121.32.

definition: τεγίδιον, τό, name of a womanʼs garment, Schwyzer 462 B 38 ( Tanagra, iii B.C.), PSI 4.341.7 (iii B.C.); τεγείδιον· κοσμάριον ποιὸν γυναικεῖον, Hsch. (this sense is possible in PSI l.c.).

children.definition: capable of being softened in water (opp. metal, which is τηκτόν), Arist. Mete. 385b13 sq.
τεγκτούς· χρηστούς (leg. χριστούς), Hsch.
wetting, moistening, Hp. Epid. 6.8.9, Aret. CA 2.1: pl., Gal. 6.592, Aret. CA 1.1.

roof, Od. 1.333, 10.559, 11.64, al. (never in Il.), Ar. Nu. 1126, 1488, Men. Sam. 246, Herod. 3.40; οὑπὶ τοῦ τέγους you on the roof! Ar. Nu. 1502, cf. V. 68; θεῶ μʼ ἀπὸ τοῦ τέγους Id. Ach. 262, cf. Lys. 3.11; τ. τοῦ οἰκήματος Th. 4.48, cf. X. Cyr. 7.5.22, HG 4.4.12, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: covered hall or chamber, τ. Παρνάσιον the temple at Delphi, Pi. P. 5.41; λιθίνῳ ἔνδον τέγει, i.e. in a cave, Id. N. 3.54.

children.label: III
children.definition: brothel, stew, AP 11.363 ( Diosc.), Plb. 12.13.2, Man. 6.143. (Not found in Trag.) (Cf. Lat. tego.)

definition: τεθαρρηκότως, Adv. pf. part. of θαρρέω,

children.definition: boldly, Plb. 2.10.7, 9.9.8, Phld. Piet. 18, D.S. 4.17, etc.

definition: τεθάφαται, Ion. 3 pl. pf. Pass. of θάπτω, f.l. in Hdt. 6.103.
τέθηπα, pf. with pres. sense, Ep. plpf. ἐτεθήπεα as impf., from ταφ- (v. fin.), of which no pres. is found:—poet. Verb, also used in Ion. and late Prose:

children.definition: to be astonished, astounded, amazed, θυμός μοι ἐνὶ στήθεσσι τέθηπεν Od. 23.105; mostly in part. τεθηπώς, amazed, astonished, Il. 4.243, 21.64, Parm. 6.7, Emp. 17.21, etc.; ἐτεθήπεα Od. 6.166: joined with the part., τέθηπα ἀκούων Hdt. 2.156, cf. Luc.
